CompetitionName: ICC WOMENS WORLD CUP 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the ICC Women's World Cup where India takes on England at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui, in what will be a repeat of the 2017 Final. The Women in Blue will look to build on their win against West Indies in their previous outing at the World Cup whereas the Heather Knight-led side will look to open their account in the marquee event.

 

TOSS:- England won the toss and elected to field.

 

Playing XI:-

India: Y Bhatia, S Mandhana, M Raj (c), D Sharma, H Kaur, R Ghosh (wk), S Rana, P Vastrakar, J Goswami, M Singh, R Gayakwad

England: T Beaumont, D Wyatt, H Knight (c), N Sciver, A Jones (wk), S Dunkley, K Brunt, K Cross, S Ecclestone, C Dean, A Shrubsole
PostMatchCommentary:
First Powerplay (1-10 Ov) :- 

India  -  37/3 (3.7 rpo) || England - 34/2 (3.4 rpo)

Second Powerplay (11-25 Ov)

India  - 51/4 (3.4 rpo) || England - 70/2 (4.7 rpo)

Second Powerplay (26-40 Ov)

India  - 46/3 (4.5 rpo) || England - 32/2 (5.1 rpo)

 

England gets off the mark in the tournament, after winning by 4 wickets against India. After having put India to bat, the English bowlers led by Charlie Dean struck in regular intervals to restrict India to 134. The Women in Blue fought back with the ball, picking up two early wickets but fifty from skipper Heather Knight helped England cross the line. The Mithali Raj-led side will look to bounce back when they take on Australia on the 19th of March. Catch us then!

 

Mithali Raj, India captain: "We definitely didn't have partnerships and it didn't go our way despite getting what we wanted after losing the toss. When you lose you always think you are short on runs. Getting 200 could have had the match go either way. Every game we've done well as a fielding unit, it is a department where we have improved. It is an honour to play alongside Jhulan Goswami, it is difficult for any fast bowler to play at this level consistently."

 

Heather Knight, England captain: "A bit of relief to be honest. A bit scrappy in the end but getting over the line was important. The mentality of the girls was great, they went out there and were aggressive, it wasn't an easy wicket and a few more on the board would have been tricky, so I just wanted to be the one out there to finish. I want to congratulate Jhulan on her 250 wickets, an amazing achievement."

 

Charlie Dean is the Player of the Match.

 

Charlie Dean: "I don't have words to say, we're very happy, to have come back from three disappointing games and win today, I'm very happy. I just tried to keep it simple, try and build some pressure, and that worked well. When you're bowling with Sophie, it makes things easier, she's an exceptional player and has shown a lot of trust in me"

TossDetails: Australia Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ICC WOMENS WORLD CUP 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the ICC Women's World Cup encounter between India and Australia at Eden Park, Auckland. This will be India's fifth game of the World Cup, having won two and lost two so far. Mithali Raj's side began the tournament with a win over Pakistan, and a comprehensive win against West Indies helped India stay in the top half of the points table. On the other hand, Australia has played 4 games so far and has remained undefeated in the tournament. Indian Pace bowler Jhulan Goswami adds another feather to her cap, by playing her 200th WODI match today.

 

TOSS:- Australia won the toss and elected to field.

 

PLAYING XI:-

India XI: S Mandhana, S Verma, Y Bhatia, M Raj (c), H Kaur, R Ghosh (wk), S Rana, P Vastrakar, J Goswami, M Singh, R Gayakwad

Australia XI: A Healy (wk), R Haynes, M Lanning (c), E Perry, B Mooney, T McGrath, A Gardner, J Jonassen, A King, M Schutt, D Brown
PostMatchCommentary:
First Powerplay (1-10 Overs):- 

India - 39/2 (3.9 rpo) || Australia - 67/0 (6.7 rpo)

Second Powerplay (11-25 Overs):-

India - 76/0 (5.1 rpo) || Australia - 75/2 (5.0 rpo)

Second Powerplay (26-40 Overs):-

India - 85/2 (5.7 rpo) || Australia - 82/0 (5.5 rpo)

Third Powerplay (41-50 Overs):-

India - 77/3 (7.7 rpo) || Australia - 56/2 (5.9 rpo)

 

Australia win a nail-biting contest in Auckland, winning by 6 wickets to book their place in the semi-finals! After having put into bat, fifties from Harmanpreet Kaur, Mithali Raj and Yastika Bhatia helped India to put on a fighting score of 277 in their 50 overs of play. In return, a composed 97 from the Australian skipper and an aggressive fifty from Alyssa Healy helped Australia to remain unbeaten and record the highest ever chase at a World Cup game. India will look to bounce back in their next match against Bangladesh. Catch us then!

 

Mithali Raj, India Captain: "When you lose you always feel you are 10-15 runs short. I think the way Australia started the innings, they were always ahead of the asking rate. The fielders couldn't back up the bowlers. The batting is something we wanted to improve and we did. We need to do well in all departments in the remaining games. The next two games are must-win. Thanks to all who came here to support the girls."

 

Meg Lanning is the Player of the Match

 

Meg Lanning, Australia Captain: "We were pretty planned coming into the game. At the halfway mark we were pretty happy with that total on this wicket. I think it was good to contribute personally, disappointing to miss out on scores in the last couple of games, but I have trained hard at the nets. Ellyse Perry is very calm and it's nice to have someone who's very comfortable at her game. I just had to trust my hands and play through the line of the ball."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ICC WOMENS WORLD CUP 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the ICC Women's World Cup encounter between India and Bangladesh at Seddon Park, Hamilton. This will be India's sixth game of the World Cup, having won two and lost three so far. The Women in Blue will look to continue their unbeaten record against Bangladesh in WODI's and move to the third spot in the table after a win tonight.

 

TOSS:- India won the toss and elected to bat.

 

PlAYING XI:-

India XI: S Mandhana, S Verma, Y Bhatia, M Raj (c), H Kaur, R Ghosh (wk), S Rana, P Vastrakar, J Goswami, P Yadav, R Gayakwad

Bangladesh XI: S Akhter, M Khatun, F Hoque, N Sultana (c/wk), R Ahmed, R Moni, L Mondal, S Khatun, N Akter, F Khatun, J Alam
PostMatchCommentary:
First Powerplay (1-10 Overs):- 

India - 52/0 (5.2 rpo) || Bangladesh - 19/2 (1.9 rpo)

Second Powerplay (11-25 Overs):-

India - 48/3 (3.2 rpo) || Bangladesh - 50/3 (3.3 rpo)

Second Powerplay (26-40 Overs):-

India - 65/2 (4.3 rpo) || Bangladesh - 48/4 (3.2 rpo)

Third Powerplay (41-50 Overs):-

India - 64/2 (6.4 rpo) || Bangladesh - 2/1 (4.0 rpo)

 

India win by 110 runs and continue their unbeaten run against Bangladesh in WODI's. After opting to bat first a determined fifty from Yastika Bhatia helped India post a competitive total on board, after which Sneh Rana took the limelight picking up 4 wickets helping India restrict Bangladesh to 119. The Women in Blue are now third in the points table and will face South Africa in their last match of the group stage on the 27th of March. Catch us then!

 

Mithali Raj, India captain: "It was important to get partnerships as it wasn't a surface where a new batter could get going instantly. We did well to get to 230 after losing those early wickets. Having all-rounders definitely gives the cushion of batting deep and it's good in a tournament like this. For a long time, we've always banked on our spinners and we have quality spinners, and today's surface did help them a lot too. We haven't played a game in Christchurch yet, so that's a challenge. It's an important game for India and we would want to do well in all departments."

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh captain: "I think it is difficult when you lose a lot of early wickets, we need to work on it. We bowled well, put pressure on India at times but the batting needs to be worked upon. Controlling the nerves in crunch situations is something we need to learn. We didn't get enough partnerships in this game and also in the last match. That's what cost us the games. Bowlers did wonderfully well today, especially Salma and Ritu. Lots of positives for us."

 

Yastika Bhatia is the Player of the Match

 

Yastika Bhatia: "Very pleased, I would have liked some more runs to contribute to the team, but nevertheless, very happy with the result. In domestic, I'd prepared for No. 3 and it was always in mind that whichever order I get, I'll have to contribute to the team so the preparation was according to that. Sometimes the wicket is not that good, so singles and strike rotation will be in my mind. It's my first Man of the Match in internationals, it really means a lot."

MatchName: India Women VS South Africa Women
Commentss: South Africa Women Won by 3  Wickets
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ICC WOMENS WORLD CUP 2022
Comments: South Africa Women Won by 3  Wickets
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the ICC Women's World Cup encounter between India and South Africa at Hagley oval, Christchurch. This will be India's final league game of the World Cup, having won three and lost three so far. The Women in Blue will look to recreate the same performance from their last match to seal a spot in the semi-finals after a win tonight.

 

Toss:-  India won the toss and elected to bat

 

India: S Mandhana, S Verma, Y Bhatia, M Raj (c), H Kaur, R Ghosh (wk), P Vastrakar, S Rana, D Sharma, M Singh, R Gayakwad 

South Africa:  L Lee, L Wolvaardt, L Goodall, S Luus (c), M du Preez, M Kapp, C Tryon, T Chetty (wk), S Ismail, M Klaas, A Khaka
PostMatchCommentary:
First Powerplay (1-10 Ov) :-

India - 68/0 (6.8 rpo) || South Africa - 50/1 (5.0 rpo)

Second Powerplay (11-40 Ov) :-

India - 155/3 (5.16 rpo) ||  South Africa - 148/3 (4.93 rpo)

Third Powerplay (41-50 Ov) :-

India - 51/4 (5.1 rpo)  || South Africa - 77/3(7.7rpo)

 

South Africa who already sealed the semi-final spot before, have won this match against India by 3 wickets and have become the party-spoilers for the team! After opting to bat first, Indian batters scored 274 runs at the end of 50 overs with the help of the fifties from Smriti Mandhana, Shafali Verma, and Mithali Raj. In reply, Laura Wolvaardt scored 80 off 79 and Mignon du Preez's  52* off 63 helped South Africa seal the game in the last ball! With this victory, South African Women have become the team to chase the second-highest score in the world cup. Unfortunately, the World cup-2022 journey for the Indian team has come to an end from the effect of loss.

 

Sane Luus - South Africa captain -"We're extremely happy, also for du Preez, for getting a fifty. She has worked hard for it after struggling early- this is how the semis is going to be , the preparation for the same couldn't have been any better. Coming into a D/N game, the experience should be good for the team. I am very happy for Lara Goodall, the way she supported Laura Woolvardt, all this will keep us good coming into the semis. I think the South Africans can be very proud of us, the way we played, the calm and the trust it's something we can be thrilled about"

 

Mithali Raj  - Indian captain - "I personally feel the girls gave it all, it was an important game, was a good game, it ended our campaign, but I'm proud of the girls for coming so far. With the bowlers we had, I thought 275 was a good total, we had defended similar totals in the past. Jhulan Goswami  experience would have added a lot, but this was an exposure for the other girls to step up. Everything should come to an end, it'll take time to settle the emotions, but that is sport. Thanks to everyone who turned out for every Indian game, it was nice to hear your cheers and keep supporting the girls and the Indian women's team in the future."

 

Mignon du Preez - Player of the Match: "I have been very fortunate, the girls have supported me throughout, I haven't had the best start to the tournament with the bat but to be able to do it today for us today was very special. The biggest thing was to take it deep. When I got in, there was still quite a few overs and we knew if we actually gave us some time, it'll get easier. Myself and Kapp said again we just need to take it as deep as possible because we know what Chloe can do. She hit a couple of boundaries. Knock means a lot, it's been a tough few weeks when I haven't contributed like I would have liked. To do it when it matters the most, getting the momentum right into the semifinal, I'll take it anytime of the week.  We can't do it without you, thank you very much for all the support."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the First Women's T20I of India tour of Sri Lanka which takes place at Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, Dambulla. After the successful completion of the Women's T20 Challenge in India, the Indian national team is all set to face Sri Lanka for a three-match T20I and ODI series. Both India and Sri Lanka have suffered losses in their previous three matches and would look to bounce back in this match. Who would perform better and open the series with a positive momentum?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India is way ahead of Sri Lanka in the head-to-head tally as India has won 14 matches. Sri Lanka has won three fixtures against India. Considering the last four fixtures between the two teams, India have won all of their matches. 

 

TOSS:-

India have won the toss and they elect to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 32/2 (5.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || Sri Lanka- 25/1 (4.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 53/3 (5.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || Sri Lanka- 36/3 (4.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 53/1 (10.6 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || Sri Lanka- 43/1 (8.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

 

The curtain raiser T20I match of the India tour of Sri Lanka was wrapped up in the favour of India who won the match by 34 runs. After winning the toss and opting to bat first, the Indian opener S Verma started well and scored 31 runs. J Rodrigues's unbeaten 36 runs off 27 deliveries aided the team to post 138 runs. In the chase, apart from the innings of K Dilhari (47* off 49), the bowlers of India dismissed the batters without leaving them to score big. In the end, India sealed the match and carry forward their 100% win record at Sri Lanka!

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lankan Captain: "We dropped a couple of catches and that last over really cost us. In the powerplay, we didn't bat to our best and played too many dot balls I felt. We have to stick with our plan and play positive cricket. The score was chaseable and we were too negative I feel. We have to be positive for chasing these scores of 139 down."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "I think credit goes to all the players for the belief and the way Jemi batted and later on the bowlers did the job for us. As a unit we always want to utilize the first six overs and apart from that it went according to plan."

 

Jemimah Rodrigues is the Player of the Match

 

Jemimah Rodrigues: "The pitches are similar to back home in Mumbai and I just applied myself, played my natural game. I love this country and it is a privilege for us to come and play some cricket here. Lot of support from the crowd and Sri Lankan cricket board as well."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
TossDetails: Sri Lanka Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Second T20I of India tour of Sri Lanka which takes place at Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, Dambulla. India displayed a dominant performance against Sri Lanka in the previous match and lead the three-match series. Sri Lanka are yet to win their first match against India at their home. Will India win this match and seal the series or will Sri Lanka fight back today and push the decider match to the next fixture?

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lanka won the toss elected to bat first!

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Gamini Perera: "it's the same pitch. The outfield gives an edge to the batters. The sound of the tap is good but if the play from the previous game has created cracks, the batters will face challenges. The pitch may slow down and 140 will be par."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

Sri Lanka- 37/0 (6.2 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || India- 52/2 (8.7 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

Sri Lanka- 53/1 (5.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || India- 50/2 (5.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

Sri Lanka- 35/6 (7.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 25/1 (6.0 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

India wins the match once again against Sri Lanka and claims the series by winning the first two matches of the three-match series. After opting to bat first, the Sri Lankan openers were splendid and partnered till the 14th over for 87 runs which is their highest opening T20I stand! After dismissing the openers back to back, the Indian bowlers came into play by taking wickets at regular intervals and dismissed all the other batters for single-digit scores. With the target of 126 runs to chase, the Indian openers started off well with Smriti Mandhana scoring 39 runs off 34 balls. Harmanpreet Kaur (31 off 32*) lead the team from the front and took the team to victory.

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lankan Skipper: "We batted well but the last six overs we did not do well. We were 15 runs shot, Harman and Smiriti batted well. Happy for the performance of Vishmi. I hope the players will do well next game."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper and Player of the Match: "Happy to win the game and the series. It was not an easy track to bat on, it was slow and turning. The way we managed was good. We batted according to the plan. It is important to stay calm and read the situation better. I am happy we were able to execute our plans."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
Commentss: Sri Lanka Women Won by 7 Wickets
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA T20 SERIES 2022
Comments: Sri Lanka Women Won by 7 Wickets
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Third and final T20I of India tour of Sri Lanka which takes place at Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, Dambulla. India won the first two matches against Sri Lanka and sealed the series. Sri Lanka are yet to win their first match against India at their home. Will India finish the series on a high or will Sri Lanka bounce back today?

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 37/1 (6.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || Sri Lanka- 47/2 (7.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 52/2 (5.8 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || Sri Lanka- 74/1 (8.2 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 49/1 (9.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || Sri Lanka- 20/0 (10.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

Sri Lanka beats India for the first time at their home and ends the T20I series with a victory, however, India won the first two matches and clinches the series! After winning the toss and electing to bat first, India scored 37 runs in the powerplay after which the Indian skipper H Kaur's unbeaten 39* off 33 and J Rodrigues's 33 off 30 steered the team to a total of 138 runs. In the chase, the skipper C Athapaththu led from the front and put up 80* runs off 48 balls along with N De Silva (30 off 28) and chased down the target with still seven wickets and three overs remaining!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper and Player of the Series: "I think Sri Lanka deserved this win, especially the way they batted. Even after the powerplay, they kept creating pressure on us. We did have partnerships but needed a better strike rate. This score wasn't enough. We need to work on our strike-rates a bit. Thanks to the crowd"

 
Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lankan Skipper and Player of the Match: "It's really good for us, we have a young side with so much inexperience. So it's a very good win for us. I controlled myself and the other batters too, tried to control the game. India is a really good side, they have experienced players and those who play franchise cricket. We played good cricket against them, but unfortunately couldn't win last two games due to certain small things. Finally we won, really good for us as the ODIs are coming up. Want to thank all the fans who came."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
TossDetails: Sri Lanka Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the First WODI between Sri Lanka and India at the Pallekele international cricket stadium. India heads into the series after clinching the T20I series 2-1 and would look to claim the ODI series as well under Harmanpreet Kaur's captaincy, who succeeded Mithali Raj as skipper of the side.

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Gamini Perera: "This was the same track that was used for the Sri Lanka-Australia T20 series. Looks dry with no grass on it, the spinners will play a big role today. Fast bowlers will have to mix their pace. No brainer that the team winning the toss should bat first."

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lanka have won the toss and will bat first.

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka captain: "We will bat first because we have a good batting line-up and will try to stick to our plans. This series is important as the points are crucial for the next World Cup. Really looking forward to playing good cricket and our youngsters doing well."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India captain: "We also wanted to bat looking at this wicket, but I feel we have an experienced line-up and back ourselves to chase whatever is put ahead of us. We have always done really well in the ODI format, some areas around partnerships with batting and bowling can be better."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-10):-

Sri Lanka - 34/2 (5x4, 0x6, 3.40 rpo) || India - 37/2 (2x4, 1x6, 3.70 rpo)

Middle Overs (Overs 11-40):-

Sri Lanka - 104/4 (7x4, 0x6, 3.47 rpo) || India - 139/4 (5x4, 3x6, 4.96 rpo)

Death Overs (Overs 41-50):-

Sri Lanka - 33/4 (3x4, 0x6, 3.96 rpo)

 

India hold their nerve in a low scoring thriller at Pallekele and win by 4 wickets to secure a 1-0 lead in the ODI series. After opting to bat, India dismissed the Sri Lankan skipper early on, after which Hasini Perera's burst in the Powerplay and Nilakshi de Silva's 43 steadied Sri Lanka's innings, but India continued to chip with wickets with Deepti Sharma and Renuka Singh picking up 3 wickets each, dismissing Sri Lanka for 171. In the chase, Oshadi Ranasinghe picked up two early wickets and Inoka Ranaweera picked up 4 wickets but 62-run partnership between skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and Harleen Deol and a 38-run partnership in the end between Pooja Vastrakar and Deepti Sharma ensured that India crossed the finish line.

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka Skipper: "We haven't been batting well. We thought 230 was a good score but couldn't stick to our plans. We need to score 230-240 to defend and need to bounce back."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Skipper: "Enjoying myself. When you keep getting runs, you feel you are in good form. We need to work on the partnerships. The Lankan bowlers didn't give us easy runs. I love to give chances. Harleen bowled well and so did Shafali. Would hope they do well in the future as well."

 

Deepti Sharma is the Player of the Match.

Deepti Sharma: "I can bat at every number. We need to focus on partnerships and that's what we did. It was not an easy wicket to bat on. We need to watch till the end. Pooja is a hard hitter and she did well."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2ND WODI between Sri Lanka and India at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium. After clinching the T20I series, India continued the same momentum in the 1ST WODI, defeating Sri Lanka by 4 wickets in a low-scoring thriller at the same venue. Can India continue their fine form and seal the series today?

TOSS:-
India win the toss and will field first.

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Captain: "We are going to bowl. There is moisture on the wicket, will want to utilize the conditions and gets some early breakthroughs. Better wicket than the previous one. Even though yesterday was an off day we came to practice and wanted to stay together. We are going with the same team."

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka Captain: "Good wicket for batting, we will stick with our plans. We have two changes, Hasini and Ama are back. 240 is a good score on this wicket. We lost a couple of wickets early and the set batters did not continue, that's why we could not get 240 in the last game."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-10):-

Sri Lanka - 26/3 (2x4, 0x6, 2.6 rpo) || India - 55/0 (7x4, 0x6, 5.5 rpo)

Middle Overs (Overs 11-40):-

Sri Lanka - 110/4 (8x4, 0x6, 3.7 rpo) || India - 119/0 (8x4, 2x6, 7.6 rpo)

Death Overs (Overs 41-50):-

Sri Lanka - 37/3 (1x4, 0x6, 3.7 rpo)

India takes an unassailable lead in the ODI series after winning by 10 wickets. After opting to bowl first, India and Renuka Singh used the new ball to great effect picking up three wickets inside the Powerplay, after which some brilliant moments of fielding ensured that India restricted Sri Lanka to just 173. In the chase, Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma scored twin fifties and notched up the highest partnership for India against Sri Lanka to help India get across the finish line without any hiccups.

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka Captain: "Our bowlers didn't bowl well. We dropped a few catches as well and catches win you matches. We lost wickets at crucial intervals as well. We need to work on areas and I will try my best to play well."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We have been talking about long partnerships. We discussed that we need to give 100 percent. The partnership was outstanding. It is important to have bowling options."

 

Renuka Singh is the Player of the Match.

Renuka Singh: "I am working on my strengths and working on my variations. I am hitting the hard lengths which is helping me here. We decided to bowl first looking at the overcast weather, thought the conditions will help us and I was told to stick to my strengths."

MatchName: Sri Lanka Women VS India Women
TossDetails: Sri Lanka Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF SRI LANKA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third and the final WODI between Sri Lanka and India at the Pallekele international cricket stadium. After claiming the T20 series, the Indian team faced Sri Lanka in the three-match ODI series. The first two matches were won by an explicit display of cricket from the Indian team and the series is in the hands of the visitors. Now, with a match still remaining, Indian players would look to whitewash the opponents and end the series on a high whereas Sri Lanka would like to take a win and register their first ODI victory against India at their home. 

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 50/1 (5.0 rpo, 5x4, 0x6) || Sri Lanka- 56/1 (5.6 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 152/5 (6.7 rpo, 11x4, 3x6) || Sri Lanka- 123/7 (4.1 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 78/3 (7.8 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) || Sri Lanka- 37/2 (4.9 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)


Indian Women once again wins the match against Sri Lanka and whitewashes the hosts by 3-0! After India was forced to bat first, S Verma (49 off 50) provided a solid start along with Y Bhatia (30 off 38) at the beginning after which, three wickets were taken in 11 balls and the opposition came into play. The Indian skipper H Kaur (75 off 88) and P Vastrakar (56* off 65) partnered for 97 runs and revived the team and also put up a good score of 255 runs on board. In reply, the Sri Lankan skipper C Athapaththu (44 off 41) started off explosively along with H Perera who made 39 runs. N De Silva (48* off 59) steadily constructed her innings and got the team nearer to the target but it was the Indian team who was better and they beat the Sri Lankan team by 39 runs and lift the trophy!

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lankan Captain: "Our batters struggled in the middle overs. Credit to the India team, they are playing some good cricket at the moment. N de Silva is a good batter and she is consistently performing well but is not able to score big runs that's not a worry for us. Rashmi is bowling well, and hope she does better in the future."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian captain and player of the match: "It was a great game for all of us, we were always in the game so very happy with this performance. We were thinking about getting singles, it was important for us to stay there and bat till the end. This is just the beginning, we have a lot more cricket coming up. We did really well in the T20 series, we just want to enjoy our cricket."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: COMMONWEALTH GAMES WOMEN'S CRICKET 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Inaugural match of the Commonwealth Games 2022 between Australia and India at Edgbaston, Birmingham. This is the first time we will witness the Women's team in cricket and this is only the second time we will see the sport in the Commonwealth games. There are a total of 8 teams and they are divided into two groups in which Pakistan, Australia, Barbados, and India are in Group A. All the teams are in contention for medals and hope India could be the best and win us gold. Let us wait and watch for an exciting opener today!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the team have played 23 matches and Australia lead the tally with 16 wins and India are with 6 wins.   

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "We will bat first. Looks a good pitch to bat on. We have a good team and hope we can compete. We are going with 3 pacers, 2 spinners and the rest is the same."

 

Meg Lanning, Australian Skipper: "I am ok with chasing and the conditions look good out here. We have quality on our side. We are playing good cricket, and happy with the preparation."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 35/1 (5.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || Australia- 41/4 (6.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 80/2 (8.8 rpo, 13x4, 0x6) || Australia- 71/3 (7.8 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 39/5 (7.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || Australia- 45/0 (11.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

 

The inaugural match of the Commonwealth games 2022 kicked off with Australia beating India by 3 wickets. After winning the toss and electing to bat first, the Indian batter S Verma played a fiery knock and scored 48 off 33. After which, the Indian skipper H Kaur scored the first fifty in the first ever match of the Commonwealth games and created a record. The team in the end put up a score of 154. In the chase, R Thakur picked four wickets in the first 13 balls of her spell within the powerplay and imposed pressure straight away on the Australian batters. A Gardner (52* off 35) played a match-winning knock along with G Harris (37 off 20) and took the team over the line without any pressure and wrapped up the match in 19 overs. Hope India could win the next match and move forward in the contention for medals!

TossDetails: Pakistan Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: COMMONWEALTH GAMES WOMEN'S CRICKET 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Commonwealth Games 2022 between India and Pakistan at Edgbaston, Birmingham. India and Pakistan both lost their previous match against Australia and Barbados respectively. This is the second match for the teams and this epic clash is vital to qualify for the knockouts. Let us wait and watch this crucial rivalry!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Pakistan have squared off against each other 11 times in a T20 match and India are way ahead in the tally with 9 wins.

 

TOSS:-

Pakistan won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Bismah Maroof, Pakistan Skipper: "It's an important match for us, we want to put up a target and defend. Nida Dar is not playing because of the concussion, Imtiaz comes in her place. Very important game to stay alive and we all are looking ahead to the game."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "Two changes. Sneh Rana in for Rajeshwar Gayakwad and I forgot another change. The changes are due to the conditions. We wanted to chase anyways in these conditions. We want to go with the same approach"
PostMatchCommentary:
UPDATE: Due to the rain delay, the match will be held with 18 overs per side, and each team will have 5 overs of powerplay!

 

Powerplay (1-5 Overs):-

Pakistan- 26/1 (5.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 52/0 (10.4 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (6-13 Overs):- 

Pakistan- 46/3 (5.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || India- 50/0 (7.5 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (14-18 Overs):- 

Pakistan- 27/6 (5.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

The second match for India and Pakistan in the Commonwealth games 2022 ended in the favour of India as the team dominated Pakistan and wins the match by 8 wickets. The toss was delayed due to rain and the match was reduced to 18 overs per side. With Pakistan winning the toss and electing to bat first, they lost their opener for no runs on board. The Indian bowlers took the momentum forward and kept on taking wickets regularly and the team was all out on the last ball of the innings for 99 runs. M Ali was the highest run-getter of the side with 32 runs. In the chase, the Indian Opener led the team from the front by scoring her 15th fifty (63* off 42) and guided the team to the victory in the 12th over with still 8 wickets remaining. India are currently at number one in the points table with 2 points and will face Barbados on Wednesday.

TossDetails: Barbados Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: COMMONWEALTH GAMES WOMEN'S CRICKET 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Commonwealth Games 2022 between India and Barbados at Edgbaston, Birmingham. In the three league matches considered for the qualification, India and Barbados have won one match each and this will be a do-or-die match for both teams to qualify for the knockouts. India displayed an amazing brand of cricket in the previous match and registered their first victory against Pakistan, whereas Barbados faced a loss against Australia. There is only one spot left in the group with Australia already qualified. Will India win the crucial match and enter the semi-finals?

 

TOSS:-

Barbados won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Hayley Matthews, Barbados Skipper: "We'll be bowling today. We obviously had to bat in our first two games and its really a good opportunity to go out today and restrict India to a total and go out and chase it. Just one change, Keila Elliott is out and Shaunte Carrington is in."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "Pooja Vastrakar is back in the side and we are really happy that she recovered very fast and looking very positive today. We are a very balanced side now. We have one more change, Tania Bhatia is replacing Yastika Bhatia"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 50/1 (8.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) || Barbados- 20/4 (3.3 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 54/3 (6.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || Barbados- 30/3 (3.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 58/0 (11.6 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || Barbados- 9/1 (1.8 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) 

 

An all-important decider between India and Barbados has been won by India in a dominating fashion by 100 runs. India lost an opener early but Shafali Verma kept the tempo high by playing in an aggressive manner and ended up scoring 43 of just 26 balls also being involved in a 70-run partnership with J Rodrigues. Rodrigues played the sheet anchor role to good effect making an unbeaten 56 of 43. Deepti Sharma who came into bat at no.6 provided the firepower at the end of the innings scoring 34* off 28 balls taking the Indian tally to 162. The bowling side of things was once again managed by Renuka Singh who was brilliant with the new ball scalping four wickets and conceding just 10 runs in her 4 overs. Half the Barbados side was back in the hut with just 34 runs on the board and it was a matter of time that other bowlers came to the party and ended things early. Indian team would be happy to end on this note and would love to carry the momentum in the next encounter which can seal a medal at the commonwealth games.

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: COMMONWEALTH GAMES WOMEN'S CRICKET 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
The first semi-finals will be played between England Women and India Women at Edgbaston, Birmingham. The epic clash will ensure an opportunity to compete for a Gold medal in the commonwealth games 2022. Although, the team ending up on the losing side too will get a chance to grab a Bronze Medal. The England side topped group B winning all three of their encounters while Team India finished second in group A winning two games out of their three. The Women in Blue having won their previous encounter would look to take the momentum in this match-up. It will attract a lot of attention when India takes on the hosts England in an all-important semi-final.

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We are looking to bat first. It seems like a fresh track and it's going to remain the same throughout the game. Before the main games, everyone is in form and performing. It's the right time to perform for the side. Our bowlers are doing well too."

 
Natalie Sciver, England Captain: "I was happy to bowl first anyway. We've been good at adapting to situations.We are on a roll, high on confidence, in our batting and bowling".
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 64/0 (10.6 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)  || England- 58/1 (9.7 rpo, 10x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 51/3 (5.7 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)      || England- 59/2 (6.6 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 49/1 (9.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)      || England- 43/3 (8.6 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

 

 

 India held on to their nerves and sealed the game finding England short of the target by four runs. It all started with Smriti Mandhana taking the attack to the opposition bowlers scoring 61(32) at a staggering strike rate of 191. Jemimah Rodrigues who came into bat at No.three made 44 of 31 balls continuing her good form from last game helping India set a target of 165. Then it was the bowling brilliance of Deepti Sharma that provided breaks on the England batters who were off to a good start in the powerplay. The Off-Spinner ended her spell conceding just 18 runs in her four overs and also accounted for one key wicket of the opener Sophia Dunkley. Sneh Rana too contributed by picking up two wickets at a crucial time in the game. India will now compete for the Gold Medal in Commonwealth game 2022.

TossDetails: Australia Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: COMMONWEALTH GAMES WOMEN'S CRICKET 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the finals of the Commonwealth Games 2022 between India and Australia at Edgbaston, Birmingham. The Indian team qualified for the semi-final match against England after winning two consecutive group stage matches. In the semi-finals, India displayed an amazing brand of cricket and won the thriller and will face Australia in the contest for the prestigious gold medal. Will India create history by clinching the inaugural commonwealth games?

 

TOSS:-

Australia won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Meg Lanning, Australian Captain: "We will bat first. Good wicket and great atmosphere. The semi-final was good, we had some good patches and some that can be tidied up but we are in a good position today and we hope to win this one. This is a big game, this is what we play for and we would love to give our best performance today."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian captain: "Toss is something which is not in our control. It's a great opportunity for us to do well here. No changes on our side today. We have a good crowd in our support."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 43/1 (7.2 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || India- 42/2 (7.0 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):-

Australia- 82/2(9.1 rpo, 10x4, 1x6) || India- 76/1 (8.4 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 36/5(7.2 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || India- 34/7 (7.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

Australia beat India by just 9 runs in a thrilling contest in the final over of the commonwealth games finals 2022, in Birmingham. Australia won the toss and elected to bat first and put up a competitive total of 161/8 on the board with Beth Mooney being the pick of the batters scoring 61 off 41 deliveries. She was involved in a match winning partnership of 74 runs with skipper Meg Lanning who made 36 off 26. The Indians were extremely electric in the field and were in control with the ball, with Renuka Singh being the pick of our bowlers (4-0-25-2). While chasing Indians were cruising towards the victory at one point with the skipper Harmanpreet Kaur leading the batting attack from the front, with an excellent 65 off 43. She got good support from Jemimah Rodrigues, who scored 33 off 33. But after that partnership, wickets fell at regular intervals. Ashleigh Gardner's all-round performance (25 off 15 & 3-0-16-3) was a game changing factor. However, in the end, the Indian women did well to get the Silver Medal for the country!

TossDetails: England Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the first of the three T20 Internationals between India and England at Chester-le-street, UK. The Indian Team will be high on confidence after their successful campaign at the Commonwealth Games where the Women in Blue defeated England Women in the semi-finals. A lot will depend on how the senior players who have experience in English conditions perform in the series. Harmanpreet Kaur would be backing the side to succeed on foreign soil after a brief time of preparation over the last few weeks. The hosts on the other side have a few of their key players missing from their line up and Amy Jones is to take charge of the team. Both the teams have some exciting talent in their squads which means one can expect a thriller of a contest.

 
TOSS:-
England Women won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 41/1 (6.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || England- 56/0 (9.3 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 60/4 (6.7 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || England- 78/1 (11.1 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 31/2 (6.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

Dunkley's 61* and Glenn's 4-wicket haul helped England win the game comfortably. It all started with India being sent in to bat with Smriti Mandhana providing a decent start along with Shefali Verma for the first four overs at the end of which Smith clinched the important wicket off Mandhana. After that, India found it a bit hard to find their way back into the game but the skipper, Harmanpreet Kaur did her best to lead from the front! She put up a good partnership with Ghosh, whose dismissal turned out to be the pivotal change after which India found it hard to recover in the death overs. But Deepti Sharma put up a hard-fought 29*(24), who was India's top scorer tonight, that helped India reach a respectable total of 132/7. Dunkley and Wyatt provided England a flying start. Sneh Rana did provide India the breakthrough but Dunkley and Capsey did turn out to be too good for the Indian bowlers today, as England cruised to their victory. England leads the series 1-0.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain:  "We were not able to get the runs we were expecting. I just feel we forcefully played because it conditions were not 100% fit to play. I am happy the girls put in the effort and they played despite there being chances of getting injured. You need to have teammates that play in whatever conditions. It was not 100% condition, the ground was too wet and there were chances of getting injured. And one of our fielders got injured and we turned out one bowler short."

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "It is important to start well and the girls did that. We kept them to a good score. The pitch was a bit skiddy and we had to play straight. Danni at the start was great, Dunks played confidently as well. It is an unbelievable top three with the form they are in."

 

Sarah Glenn is the player of the match

Sarah Glenn: "I thought we did very well as a unit. It was difficult to grip the ball and try to bowl stump to stump. I knew the conditions out there and if we'd play our game, we'd be fine."

TossDetails: England Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second of the three T20 Internationals between India and England at County Ground, Derby. It was England Women that got the better of the Women in Blue in the previous encounter at Chester-le-street. Team India was restricted to a total of 132 after being asked to bat first courtesy of some brilliant bowling display from the Leg spinner Sarah Glenn who went on to scalp four wickets in her four over spell. Deepti Sharma's unbeaten 29 of 24 was the top score for Team India. In reply, the English Team got off to a flying start amassing 60 runs in the powerplay and thereafter the Indian Team could not come back in the game. Sophia Dunkley's 61* of 44 and Alice Capsey's 32 of 20 balls sealed the game for the hosts. The Indian team would look to bounce back in the second game to keep the series alive. 

 

TOSS:-

England Women won the toss and elected to Bat first!

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "We've had some good success here batting first.I don't think the wicket will change much so want to get going."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We were looking to bowl anyway. "It's an opportunity for us. We want to play our natural game and play to our strengths."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

England - 29/3 (4.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || India- 55/1 (7.8 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

England- 74/2 (8.2 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  || India- 70/1 (7.7 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) 

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

England- 39/1 (7.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || India- 21/0 (15 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) 

 

It was England's call to bat first after winning the toss which backfired. Harmanpreet Kaur's tactical move to introduce Spin in the powerplay got the big wicket of Sophia Dunkley who was the top scorer in the previous game. Some brilliance in the field from Radha Yadav resulted in a crucial run out at a crucial time in the game. Thereafter, it was Sneh Rana who ran through the England middle order which meant that the hosts could manage only 142 from their 20 overs. The off-spinner accounted for three wickets in her four over spell. In response, the opening pair of Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma came out all guns blazing taking the England bowlers to the cleaners. The duo added 55 runs in the powerplay to put Team India in the driver's seat. Mandhana remained unbeaten on 79 of just 53 balls taking the team home in style. It was a strong performance by the Women in Blue to level the series. 

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "I think we were under-par, but after the start we had, we did well to get us to 142. Freya and Bouchier , two batted well to give us a good crack at defending . As a team, we want to play fearlessly and take it to the opposition, it didn't happen tonight though, credit to the Indian openers"

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " I'm really happy, we played well. Everyone was looking forward to winning today, that's something I'm happy about. We do have plans for all batters, but it was important that we executed them, the fielders supported the bowlers well. We are improving as a fielding side, the way Radha fielded, she got injured in the last game, I'm happy with her effort today"

 

Smriti Mandhana, player of the match: "We were keen to come back stronger and level the series. I was pushing myself and happy that I could contribute to the victory. Good weather to bat in England, before the CWG games, I think I found the touch back, in T20 cricket, you'd look to try and get a good start to the team. Happy to contribute to the team"

TossDetails: England Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third T20 International between India and England at Bristol, UK. The hosts won the series opener comprehensively while the Women in Blue came back in emphatic fashion in the second game of the series. Smriti Mandhana's knock of 79* runs of 53 balls took India home by 8 wickets in the 17th over of the match. The momentum is with the Indian side and the chance to register their first T20 series win in England would also be at the back of their heads. It will be an exciting contest against a young and competent English side which has shown a lot of promise in absence of some key players.

 

Toss:

England Women won the toss and elected to field first.

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "It didn't matter too much but we did think the dew had a little effect in the last game. We didn't get enough runs, and we didn't bowl our best ball for long enough"

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " We would have bowled first too. But does not matter much, we still can win if we play quality cricket as we have in the past. Just one change today, S. Meghana comes in for Kiran Navgire".
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 20/3 (3.3 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || England- 45/0 (7.5 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 49/3 (5.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || England- 47/3 (5.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 53/2 (10.6rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || England- 23/0 (7.2 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

 

The England Team made the new ball count after electing to bowl first. The Indian Top order was back in the pavilion by the end of the powerplay with just 20 on board. The first half of the first innings belonged to the bowling side. Thereafter, there was a counterattack from Deepti Sharma, Richa Ghosh and Pooja Vastrakar which helped India get to a respectable total of 122. Richa Ghosh was the top scorer with 33 runs of just 22 balls. In reply, the English batters played cautiously stitching together a 70 run opening stand. The Indian team did manage to come back in the game courtesy of Radha Yadav who conceded just 14 runs in her four-over spell also picking up the wicket of the England Skipper Amy Jones. But, the Inform batter Alice Capsey along with Bryony Smith took the team home with 10 balls to spare. 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "I think we were 20 run short and we need to give credit to our bowlers because of whom we were still in the game. Radha Yadav especially, gives 100 percent on the field and we need more characters like her. Even Richa Ghosh provided fire power at the end which gave us a chance to defend. We need to put on more runs on the board to win games which did not happen today but we learn from every mistake"

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "Feels nice, proud of the unit overall. The first game was quite daunting with less number of ,senior players around but a win in the first game settled our nerves pretty well. Someone Like Capsey is so good, plays freely and has got all shots in the book. Ecclestone too has been brilliant and helps around other bowlers too. She is world Class and we now look forward to the ODIs"

 

Sophie Ecclestone, Player of the Match: I think the rules have changed a little and that has helped. I have enjoyed being the vice captain. Amy has been a great captain to play under. Quite nice to see the youngsters take some responsibility.

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the First of the Three ODIs between England and India at County Ground, Hove. Both the teams come into the series with three wins on the trot. The hosts England defeated South Africa while Women in Blue did a similar feat against Sri Lankan Women. Although, England will ride on the momentum gained in the recently concluded T20 Series, India is a formidable side especially with Jhulan Goswami returning to the side for one last time. The 39 year old Pacer is the leading wicket taker in Women's Cricket with 252 scalps to her name. This is her final series and a pleasant farewell will be ideal for one of the Women's Cricket Legends, Jhulan Goswami.

 

TOSS:-

India Women won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

England- 26/2 (2.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)   || India- 59/1 (5.9 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

England- 138/4 (4.6 rpo, 13x4, 0x6)  || India- 145/2 (4.8 rpo, 11x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs):- 

England- 63/1 (6.3 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)  || India- 28/0 (6.7 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

 

A clinical performance from the Indian Team after winning the toss and asking England to bat first. India's Spearhead Jhulan Goswami set the platform pretty well giving nothing away to the English batters early on. She completed her quota of ten overs conceding just 20 runs and also accounting for one top-order wicket. Thereafter, it was the Spinners that took charge of the ship. 5 out of the 7 wickets to fall went to the spinners. Deepti Sharma was the pick of the bowlers with 2 scalps for just 33 runs. England batters just managed to put up 227 runs on the board which was below par on this wicket. In response, Smriti Mandhana came out all guns blazing. A 96 run stand with Yastika Bhatia put India in the driver's seat. Mandhana was the top scorer amassing 91 at a strike rate of 92. Later on, an unbeaten 74 from the Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur took India home with almost six overs to spare.

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "Dissapointed that, we didn't do enough with the bat. But I think Alex batted brilliantly to give us a chance, but we needed some more wickets in the powerplay. We thought it was a tricky wicket, but I think India bowled well and then losing regular wickets cost us. Shefali's wicket early was very important, but we needed a couple more in the powerplay. I think Harman and Smriti batted very well."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " We are very happy with the support we have got, very motivating. Very important win, we showed the character we were talking about in the T20Is. It was a crucial toss to win, and then there was a great bowling partnership between Meghna and Jhulan. I think everyone who came on gave us breakthroughs.  I think there was a great partnership between Yashtika and Smriti, happy with the way I batted as well. Very important to get amongst the runs"

 

Player of the match is Smriti Mandhana.

"I think I would have enjoyed it a bit more if I stayed not out, but big thanks to the Indian crowd for coming out to watch, glad we could put up a show for you guys. I think the One Day format is a natural game for me, because I like to go out there and time the ball, in T20Is I need to work on my strike rate. Really happy to score for India regardless of format and get that W on the board".

TossDetails: England Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second ODI between India and England at St. Lawrence Ground, Canterbury. Women in Blue looked in their element in the first ODI when they beat England comprehensively by 7 wickets. Smriti Mandhana was the top scorer for India in the chase scoring 91 runs while valuable contributions from Yastika Bhatia and Harmanpreet Kaur helped to seal the game with ease. The hosts will look to bounce back in this 'do or die encounter or else the team will have nothing to play for in the final ODI at Lords. On the other hand, Team India would look to continue the winning momentum and seal the series today itself. It is Women in Blue's 300th ODI match overall and a Victory today will seal Team India's first series win in England since 1999.

 

 

TOSS:-

England Women won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "We think it'll get a bit nicer under lights, we've been focussing on their strengths. We have a few changes,  Lauren Bell is in for Issy Wong, and Freya Kemp for Davidson Richards". 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " We would have bowled too. Today is a very important day for us as we can seal the series today itself. We have made two changes , Meghna and Sneh out, and Renuka and Hemalatha in"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

India- 60/1 (6.0 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)  || England- 66/3 (6.6 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

India- 152/3 (5.0 rpo, 11x4, 4x6)  || England- 157/6 (5.2 rpo, 13x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs):- 

India- 121/1 (12.1 rpo, 18x4, 3x6)  || England- 22/1 (5.2 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

A clinical performance once again from the Indian Team after being asked to bat first. Smriti Mandhana and Yastika Bhatia ensured that India got off to a solid start. Both stitched together a 54 run partnership to set the tone for the middle order. Thereafter the Indian Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur took over things in her hand. The hard hitting batter scored an unbeaten 143 of 111 balls also being involved in a match winning partnership with Harleen Deol. The duo compiled 113 runs of just 125 balls putting India in the driver's seat. It was always going to be an uphill task for the England women chasing 334 runs against the bowling attack of Women in Blue. The Indian bowlers never let any batter settle down, Renuka Singh was brilliant especially with the new ball and scalped 4 wickets in her ten overs. The spinners kept the scoring rate in check from the other end. England fell short by 88 runs eventually. India Women create history as it is their first series win after 1999 in England.

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "Every loss is tough and they got away from us at the end with the bat. Harman batted extremely well. We didn't get close enough, didn't get partnerships. Harmanpreet Kaur is very tough to bowl to, and for our young talents, this is a good learning. Wherever we bowled, she was finding the boundary. There are points to be had in the next game, so we need to improve". 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur is the player of the match.

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " When we came here, that was the goal (to win the series). Was a crucial win today as everybody stepped up. I always enjoy leadership as I'm always in the game and it feels good. When I was batting, during the first 50 runs, it wasn't all that easy. I just took my time and the partnership with Harleen was important. Just gave freedom to myself later as I was well set."

TossDetails: England Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA WOMEN TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third and final ODI between India and England at Lord's Cricket Ground, London. The women in Blue have wrapped up the series in England for the first time since 1999, thanks to the invaluable 143 runs made by skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and Renuka Singh's 4-wicket haul in Canterbury. This game would mark the end of Jhulan Goswami's remarkable 20-year international career. She is the only Indian woman to have over 350 international wickets. The women in blue would be looking forward to helping this legend end her career on a high note at the home of cricket while the English women would be looking to secure a win in this historic stadium to avoid a whitewash.

 

TOSS:-

England women won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

India- 32/4 (3.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  ||  England- 35/2 (3.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

India- 117/4 (3.9 rpo, 12x4, 0x6) ||  England- 102/7 (3.4 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs):- 

India- 20/2 (3.5 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) ||  England- 16/1 (4.6 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

A low-scoring thriller at Lord's with so many twists and turns as the women in blue edge past the English women and win the game by 16 runs! After being asked to bat first, the Indian women put up a challenging total of 169, thanks to the half-centuries from Smriti Mandhana and Deepti Sharma. Kate Cross was the pick of the English bowlers with her brilliant 4/26. Indian bowlers did an excellent job of defending the total. Renuka Thakur dismantled the English top order with her 4/29. Jhulan Goswami and Rajeshwari Gayakwad chipped in with a couple of vital wickets each as well as India wrapped the English batters for 153. Great fight put up by 21-year-old Charlie Dean with the bat but it wasn't quite enough as India women whitewashed the England women. It was a very fitting farewell for the legend of the game, Jhulan Goswami.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " This wicket was not easy to bat on, our batters did a decent job. We were looking for 170 after losing four wickets. After that, we knew we have the pace attack and spin attack to take the wickets. When I debuted Jhulan Goswami was a leader, before the game I told her when I was going through the best time people supported me but when I was in a rough time she was the one who supported me. I wanted to thank her and tell her she is always with us."

 

Amy Jones, England Captain: "Not happy with the result. I think we bowled well and needed a bigger partnership there through the middle. Been massive learning for me, not much experience captaining, learned the hard way in the second ODI. Great opportunity and the girls have been supportive and I've really enjoyed it. Thank you to Lise, she's been brilliant. What she's brought to the group we'll remember and move forward with. All the best for the future but we'll miss having her around."

 

Player of the match is Renuka Singh Thakur.

Renuka Singh Thakur: "I go back and talk to my coach, who tells me whenever there is a bad phase, he always motivates me and gives me confidence to improve. I was very excited to play alongside Jhulan, when she made her debut, I was just 3. I get inspired by her. Will go back and work on my basics. It's a dream to play here at Lord's"

MatchName: India Women VS Sri Lanka Women
TossDetails: Sri Lanka Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Indian Women Team will lock horns with the Sri Lankan Women team in their Asia cup opener at Sylhet, Bangladesh. After, a successful tour of England, Women in blue will look to continue the winning momentum in the all-important Asia Cup. This promises to be a cracking contest between two teams that are the favorites to win the tournament. T20 is a game of momentum and a slight lapse can cost you a game that can affect a team's run in the tournament. Thus, both teams would look to start on a positive note and gather confidence going ahead in the tournament. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Sri Lanka have squared off 22 times, Women in Blue India are way ahead in the tally with 16 wins while Sri Lankan Team has managed to get over the line on 4 occasions.

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lankan Women won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 33/2 (5.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)  || Sri Lanka- 43/2 (7.1 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 71/3 (7.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)  || Sri Lanka- 48/4 (5.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 46/3 (9.2 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)   || Sri Lanka- 18/4 (5.6 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

Sri Lanka started well after electing to bowl first as both the Indian openers were back in the pavilion within the powerplay. Thereafter, the returning Jemimah Rodrigues led the counterattack and made sure that the match does not slip out of hand. She stitched together a match winning partnership of 92(71) runs with Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur. She finished with 76 runs at a strike rate of 143 helping India reach a fighting total of 150 on a slow track at Sylhet. In response, the Sri Lankan openers started well but the introduction of spin straight away applied breaks in the Sri Lankan scoring rate. Also, courtesy of some brilliance in the field the Lankan batters were on the backfoot and behind the 9 ball. The bowlers were economical and kept picking wickets at regular intervals not allowing Lankan women to settle in. In the end, they fell short by 41 runs. 

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka Captain: "We lost a couple of wickets in the crucial times, especially the run-outs. Jemimah batted very well in these conditions and we have to stick with our plans in the next few games."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: " We did not start off well but those crucial run-outs and we kept getting wickets. We are happy as few of our bowlers stood up, especially Deepti Sharma. After losing crucial wickets, Jemimah played really well, thats what we were expecting from her. "

 

Jemimah Rodrigues, Player of the match: " Nothing like coming back and playing for India. I would like to thank Mumbai  the heat is the same here as it is where I stay back in Mumbai. The wicket was tricky, it kept on the lower side, initially it was not turning, but then it turned. But I had prepared well for this, even in Bangalore I asked for slower and turning wickets. That preparation really helped me here. We will take the win and take the positives from this win"
