PreMatchCommentary:
Match 6 of Women's Asia Cup 2022 will be played between the tournament favorites India and the team from Malaysia that has a lot to prove in this tournament. Women in blue come into the game after a clinical performance against Sri Lanka. Courtesy of some tactical batting from Jemimah Rodrigues the team managed to put up a defendable total on board and thereafter it was the spinners that restricted the opposition. On the other hand, Malaysia suffered a defeat against Pakistan and will look to bounce back in this encounter. The two teams clashed in the 2018 edition of Asia cup where India handed a 142-runthe  defeat with Mithali Raj being the Player of the match. 

 

TOSS:-

Malaysia Women won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Winifred Duraisingam, Malaysia Captain: "We would try to do better from the pervious game. We are very excited to play against the top ranked players. We must enjoy. We would look to follow our process. We would look to give it our best."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Captain: "We were looking to bat first anyway, as they wanted to give all the batters enough opportunity out in the middle.
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 47/0 (7.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  || Malaysia- 16/2 (3.07 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 73/1 (8.1 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 61/3 (12.2 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

 

Post Match:

India experimented with a new opening pair of Sabbhineni Meghana and Shafali Verma after being asked to bat first by Malaysia. Both the openers came out all guns blazing and made sure that the opposition is on the backfoot from the very beginning. The Openers stitched together a partnership of 116 runs off just 83 balls in which Meghana played the role of an aggressor while Shafali played second fiddle. spoilsportMeghana top scored with 69 runs while Shafali finished at 46 of 39 deliveries. Richa Ghosh batting at number.3 took on the bowling straightaway smashing an unbeaten 33 at a strike rate of 174. A target of 182 was always going to be difficult for the Malaysian team against this Indian bowling attack. India started with spin from both ends and managed to restrict Malaysia at 16/2 in 5.2 overs. Rain played spoilsport and the match is adjudged in India's favour using the DL method. India Women win their second game of Asia Cup by 30 runs and will now face UAE in their next encounter of the tournament. 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Captain: "We knew the rain might come, so we wanted to get the five overs in quickly. Hence we started with two spinners. I think Meghana and Shafali batted really well, Richa was also very expressive in the end." 

 

Winifred Duraisingam, Malaysia Captain: "We wanted to play the full game, but sadly the rain came just after five overs. The girls were really excited for this game, you could see that in our energy. It will be a good learning curve. We don't get too many opportunities at this level, so when we do you could see the energy levels."

 

Sabbhineni Meghana , Player of the match: " Always special to score for the team and represent my country. I wasn't thinking too much about the wicket, I was playing to my strengths. I think the partnership with Shafali has really helped me, we took our chances whenever we could."

MatchName: India Women VS United Arab Emirates Women
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of Match 8 of Women's Asia Cup, 2022 between India and UAE. The Women in blue have started with a bang winning both of their previous encounters, one against Sri Lanka and the other against Malaysia just a day ago. UAE on the other hand lost their previous game against Sri Lanka. The Indian team rested a few of their players in order to keep them fresh for the business end of the tournament and that looks like the template going forward in this hectic Asia Cup schedule. Indian Skipper, Harmanpreet Kaur believes in the ideology of the rotation policy which will give enough time in the middle to the bench strength that possesses a lot of talent. India is the tournament favorite but there should not be any room for complacency in a format where winning momentum matters the most.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

This pitch is getting better for batting. There are some cracks that will hold up. It's getting drier and drier.

 

 

TOSS:-

India Women won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Smriti Mandhana India Captain: "We will bat first. It's a good wicket to bat and we want our batters sto go out there and put up a good score. Malaysia were amazing, we're excited to play UAE for the first time. It's going to be a good contest. Four changes for us" 

 

Chaya Mughal, UAE Captain: "We wanted to bowl first, our bowling is slightly weak and we want to do our best. There is pressure when we play elite teams, but we will play our normal game and enjoy ourselves. Will look to restrict them to as less as possible. One change for us"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 27/3 (4.5 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || UAE- 23/3 (3.8 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 91/0 (10.11 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)   || UAE- 33/0 (3.6 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 60/2 (12.0 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || UAE- 18/1 (3.6 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

Post Match:

A new opening pair began the proceedings for India after winning the toss and electing to bat first. The team was in a bit of trouble after losing three early wickets within the powerplay but thereafter it was a brilliant match winning 128 run stand between Jemimah Rodrigues and Deepti Sharma that demoralised the UAE bowling attack. Deepti made 64 off 49 balls while Jemimah remained unbeaten with 75 of just 45 balls. A total of 178 for UAE was always going to be difficult to chase down. UAE lost 3 wickets with just 5 runs on board and could not find its way back into the game. India eventually wins the game convincingly by 104 runs and will now face Pakistan in their Asia Cup encounter.  

 

Chaya Mughal, UAE Captain: " I mean the way we started bowling, it was really good. We need improvements in some of the areas. When you have a good start, you need to carry on with same momentum. We have got good openers but unfortunately they couldn't work much."

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain: "I think they bowled really well in the Powerplay. Jemimah and Deepti batted really well to help us get back in the game. They batted well. We had one dropped catch. They didn't give their wicket away so well played to them as well." 

 

Jemimah Rodrigues , Player of the match: " My mindset is simple. I just go out there and score as much as I can for the team. I just wanted to pick up the momentum. I had the same talk with Deepti. It took some time as it is not the easiest of wickets but it always helps with such a partner at the other end."

TossDetails: Pakistan Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of  Women's Asia Cup, 2022 match between India and Pakistan. The Women in blue have been in top notch form and have managed to win all their previous three games convincingly. Pakistan on the other hand have won two out their three encounters so far. India rides on the winning momentum while Pakistan suffered a defeat against Thailand. Will India continue their streak or will Pakistan try to break it?

TOSS:

Pakistan won the toss and elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Pakistan- 33/3 (5.5 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 30/2 (5.0 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Pakistan- 74/0 (8.2 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || India- 60/4 (6.7 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Pakistan- 30/3 (6.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 34/4 (7.7 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

Pakistan gets the better of the Indian team as they win the match by 13 runs. After winning the toss and opting to bat first, the Pakistan Skipper B Maroof (32 off 35) and N Dar (56 off 37) put up a partnership of 76 runs which steered the team to a total of 137 runs. In the second innings, the bowlers of Pakistan dismissed the Indian batters in regular intervals. R Gosh almost took the team over the line with her blasting innings of 26 from 13, but the opposition bowlers held their nerve and restricted the team from chasing the target.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "I think in the middle we were trying to give other batters a chance. That cost us today. It was a chaseable target. In the middle overs, we were not able to rotate the strike. They played good cricket and deserved to win. We need to work on areas and be strong."

 

Bismah Maroof, Pakistan Skipper: "It was an important game for us. We executed well. Nida batted and bowled really well. We just wanted to make a partnership. Nida played a crucial innings and helped us get to a good total. We didn't assess the conditions really well. We all executed the plans well today."

 

Nida Dar is the Player of the Match

Nida Dar: "It was a slow start for us. Bismah told me we need to get a partnership. It was a good wicket for the batters. I needed to hit to my strong areas. Last three-four overs, it was low scoring. We need to work on that aspect."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of  Women's Asia Cup, 2022 match between India and Bangladesh. The Women in blue have been in top-notch form and have managed to top the table but lost their previous encounter with Pakistan and will be looking to get back on track. Bangladesh on the other hand has won two out of their three encounters so far. Will India get back on track or will Bangladesh emerge victorious to confirm their spot in the top 4?

 

TOSS:

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain: " We would like to bat first. It is a good wicket to bat on and runs on the board and create pressure. We have a good batting unit and will try to put up a good total. Anything above 140 would be great. Harman, Hema, and Radha are out today with niggles." 

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Captain: "We wanted to bowl first because we have a good chasing record against them. Seeing our bowlers' strength we think restricting them to under 120 would be a chaseable total. We are just taking it one game at a time. We have one change - Shamima goes out and Lata comes in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 59/0 (9.7 rpo, 8x4, 1x6) || Bangladesh- 30/0 (5.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 56/2 (6.2 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || Bangladesh- 40/3 (4.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 44/3 (8.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || Bangladesh- 30/4 (6.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

India wins the match comprehensively against Bangladesh by 59 runs and qualifies for the semi-finals of the women's Asia cup 2022. After winning the toss and batting first, India put up a competitive total of 159 on the board, thanks to the 96 runs opening stand between Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma and an excellent cameo by Jemimah Rodrigues who scored 35*(24). Bangladesh never seemed to be in the contest, the way the Indian bowlers bowled. The women in blue let the hosts score only 100 runs in 20 overs and ended up winning the game without any complications.

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain: "We came back well. Really proud of the girls. Today it was a whole team performance. Shafali batted well at the start, Jemi did well in the end. I liked Deepti's approach for those five balls. We were clinical as a bowling unit. We have to keep bowling dot balls and make them make mistakes. It is not easy for pace bowlers on this track to pick wickets. All of them actually bowled really well." 

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Captain: "We didn't bowl well in the powerplay and after. We bowled too many loose balls and they hit well. Even though we couldn't get a lot in our batting powerplay, that [bowling] cost us eventually. Even though we controlled the first innings after ten overs, our main bowlers didn't bowl in the right areas."

 

Shafali Verma is the Player of the Match

Shafali Verma: "I am always thinking about what the team wants and am always ready for that. I was thinking about bowling in good areas. While batting, it was tough because it was coming low. It's all because of the hard work and 50 has come after a long time, so I am happy"

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of  Women's Asia Cup, 2022 match between India and Thailand. The Women in blue have been in excellent form and have managed to win four out of five games. Thailand women on the other hand have won three out of their five encounters so far. India rides on the winning momentum. Thailand women are currently sitting in fourth place and will be looking to seal the spot. They will want to capitalize on Bangladesh's loss today. Skipper Smriti Mandhana is playing her 100th T20I today. Will it be a memorable game for the skipper or will Thailand play killjoy?

 

TOSS:-

India Women won the toss and elected to bowl first!

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain: "We'll like to field first. It has rained a little bit, the outfield is a bit wet, it's better we field first. We'll go out there and try to play the best cricket that we can. If we do that, we'll be able to get those two points. It's pretty special to play 100 T20Is for India. Meghna Singh comes in for Renuka." 

 

Naruemol Chaiwai, Thailand Captain: "We would have bowled first as well. The pitch is good, it won't change much. Would be the best thing in the world if we win today and qualify for the semis. We have one change."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Thailand- 16/1 (2.7 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 40/1 (6.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Thailand- 21/8 (2.3 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Thailand- 0/1 (0 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

India moves into the semi-finals after winning against Thailand in their last group game by 9 wickets. After winning the toss and electing to bowl first, the Indian spinners bundled out Thailand for 37 with Sneh Rana picking up 3 wickets. In the chase, S Meghana smashed 20* and India reached the target inside the Powerplay to finish their group stage with a victory.

 

Naruemol Chaiwai, Thailand Captain: "Very good experience for us to play with a top-class team. We should have done a better job. The more games we play, we'll get more experience."

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain: "Playing for India and playing the 100th T20I, it's a special feeling and this Indian team is a fun team to play with. Thailand played good cricket in this tournament. We were looking forward to coming out and playing our best. Our bowlers were brilliant and all three batters did their job. We have the semifinal after two days. We'll be working hard, looking forward to going out and playing that."

 

Sneh Rana is the Player of the Match

Sneh Rana: "I enjoyed a lot and I am receiving this award after a long time. I get support from other bowlers, coach and captain. Whenever I get an opportunity, I utilize it wisely. I keep on focusing on my strengths. The confidence is high and we'll do better in the coming games."

TossDetails: Thailand Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of  Women's Asia Cup, 2022 semi-finals 1 match between India and Thailand. The Women in blue have been in brilliant form and have managed to win five out of six games and topped the table. Thailand women on the other hand have won three out of their six encounters so far and managed to hold on to the fourth position. India rides on the winning momentum, having won the previous encounter with Thailand in a crushing manner. Thailand women will want to avenge their loss while India will also be looking to qualify for the finals without any complications. Harmanpreet Kaur is back as the skipper today. Jemimah Rodrigues will be a player to be watched, having scored 188 runs within 4 innings out of 6 matches at an average of 94 with a strike rate of 144 along with 2 half-centuries. We have an exciting knockout game ahead of us!

 

TOSS:-

Thailand women won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "Big game for all of us. Happy that the sun came out. Has been raining the last few days. Very positive about whatever we've done yesterday in training. Very difficult to select the XI. Harmanpreet, Renuka Thakur, Radha Yadav in for S Meghana, Meghna Singh, and Kiran Navgire."

 

Naruemol Chaiwai, Thailand Captain: "We would like to bowl. In the morning, there might be movement. India are a strong team. Same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-
India- 47/1 (7.8 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) || Thailand - 18/2 (3.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 70/2 (7.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || Thailand - 32/2 (3.6 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 31/3 (6.2 rpo, 0x4, 1x6) || Thailand - 24/5 (4.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

India women move into the finals of Women's Asia Cup 2022 after winning against Thailand by a large margin of 74 runs. After losing the toss and being put to bat first India got off to a great start, thanks to Shafali Verma's 42 off 28. Later on, skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and Jemimah Rodrigues came in handy for the women in blue, to put up a respectable total of 148. India dominated the game from the start with the ball, only letting the Thailand women score half of what they did, bundling them for 74-9 in 20 overs. Deepti Sharma was the pick of the Indian bowlers, giving just 7 runs for 3 wickets!

 

Naruemol Chaiwai, Thailand Captain: "It's a good experience for us. We have a talented side, and we'll go upwards as we play more. We have to show more intent and enjoy ourselves a bit more. If we can do that, we'll be happy."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We batted really well, Thailand also bowled well, didn't give away loose balls. Wwe were able to get good partnerships for a decent total. Coming back to the side, you need those runs, Shafali and Jemi looked good. We just need to continue that. Deepti is someone who is ready to bowl in any situation, and having that kind of bowler also helps a captain, the way she is bowling, it's great to watch."

 

Shafali Verma is the Player of the Match

Shafali Verma: "Now, I am a bit confident, I will keep working hard and I'm always happy to contribute to the team. The wicket is good to bat. Smriti did well, Jemi also did well. We have to work on partnerships. We hope the weather stays good for the final."

MatchName: India Women VS Sri Lanka Women
TossDetails: Sri Lanka Women won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP WOMENS 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of  Women's Asia Cup, 2022 finals between India and Sri Lanka happening at Sylhet International Cricket Stadium. The Women in blue have been in exceptional form and are in finals after topping the table and comprehensively beating Thailand in the semis. Sri Lanka, on the other hand, have also been playing some great cricket. Their road to the finals has had some close matches, including the 1-run win in the semifinals against Pakistan. Sri Lanka and India have played each other in the finals of the Women's Asia Cup four times and India emerged winners every single time. Will the Sri Lankan women repeat what their men did this year and win the Asia cup for the first time? Or will the women in blue continue their excellent form and be crowned the champions of the continent for the 7th time and continue their dominance? We have an absolute banger game ahead of us.

 

TOSS:

Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Sri Lanka- 16/5 (2.7 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 42/2 (7.0 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Sri Lanka- 24/3 (2.7 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) || India- 29/0 (11.6 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Sri Lanka- 25/1 (5.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

India wins the match in a crushing manner against Sri Lanka, by 8 wickets, and are crowned the champions of women's Asia cup 2022. After winning the toss and batting first, Sri Lanka were never in the game and were able to put up only 65 runs on the scoreboard. Renuka Singh was the pick of our bowlers with 3/5 in 3 overs. Rajeshwari Gayakwad and Sneh Rana clinched a couple of wickets each as well. Smriti Mandhana's quick-paced 51* off 25 ensured that India reached the given target in just 8.3 overs. INDIA WOMEN ARE THE CHAMPIONS OF THE ASIA!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Captain: "We should give credit to the bowlers and the fielding unit was very good today from ball one. We didn't want to give them easy runs as every ball is important, proud of the way we performed today. You gotta read the wicket and place the field accordingly. We did that very well and placed the fielders accordingly and that really helped us. We were not looking at the scoreboard and we were just looking at the short targets we had for ourselves and it all worked out well." 

 

Chamari Athapaththu, Sri Lanka Captain: "Tough day as a team, not a good batting display in the finals and I'm really upset today. Next, we have T20 World Cup and we learned a lot of things in this tournament as a batting unit, we have to stick with our plans. I'm really happy with my bowling unit. We have a couple of young players and hope they continue their performances as a batting unit. We do not have a lot of experienced players, but they are good players and think they will play a lot of cricket in the future."

 

Renuka Singh is the Player of the Match

Renuka Singh: "Very happy because the last few games I didn't bowl well. I practiced with my coach and the staff and they really helped me get back my rhythm. Just focussed on my basics and got success. My whole team supported me really well and credit should go to my captain, coach and staff."

 

Deepti Sharma is the Player of the tournament:

Deepti Sharma: "Really happy with the way we performed as unit from the first game till today. We executed what was discussed in the meeting. I just back my strengths and those things helped me a lot in this tournament. The wickets were slow and before this tournament, I worked a lot on my batting and those sessions really helped me. This win gives us a lot of confidence going into the upcoming series as well."

TossDetails: Australia Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Women tour of India 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the curtain raiser match of the Australia tour of India where the two teams clash against each other in five T20Is. The first two matches take place at Dr. DY Patil Stadium, Mumbai while the next three would be played at Brabourne CCI, Mumbai. The year 2022 has been amazing for the Indian women as they have entertained us throughout and have also brought us laurels by winning the Asia Cup title and for also bagging the Silver Medal in their maiden appearance in the Common Wealth Games. The Indian team would look to wrap up by winning their final series of this year while the Australian team would also like to impose their authority. This is going to be a scintillating series without any doubt and let us all wait for the final result.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Australia have locked horns against each other 25 times and Australia has won 18 matches while India has won 6. 

 

TOSS:-

Australia won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 48/2 (8.0 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || Australia- 47/0 (7.8 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 67/2 (7.5 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || Australia- 89/1 (9.9 rpo, 12x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 57/1 (11.4 rpo, 9x4, 1x6) || Australia- 37/0 (11.6 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

The first match of the five-match T20I series has ended in the favour of the visitors Australia. Australia won the toss and elected to bowl first. The Indian openers Shafali Varma (21 off 10) and Smriti Mandhana (28 off 22) started aggressively and scored a total of 48 runs within the powerplay. The fiery knock from R Ghosh (36 off 20) and Deepti Sharma (36* off 15) steered the team to a total of 172 runs. In the second innings, A Healy scored 37 runs in 23 balls and the other opener B Mooney went on to play a match-winning knock of 89* runs off 57 along with T Mcgrath who scored (40* off 29). In the end, the team chased the target with 9 wickets remaining.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "It was a decent total and we were in the game till the 13th over. But after that, we gave away too many boundaries and even the fielding was not up to the mark. Night games are always like that - sometimes it's difficult to judge the ball. But we have to take those chances to win. Yes, dew played a role. Our bowlers were trying our best. But once they got their reprieves, they played freely. Have to take those chances to win."

 

Alyssa Healy, Australian Captain: "It wasn't that easy when we were on the field. I thought they were below par. As per stats 185 is a par score here. We didn't finish great with the ball but we knew we were in the game. Probably will look to tidy up the death bowling and some other areas."

 

Beth Mooney is the Player of the Match

Beth Mooney: "Love putting the Australian shirt on first and foremost. And fortunate enough to come up a few times against India as well. Played a couple of nice shots tonight and glad to get the team over the line. Really nice wicket. Fast outfield and a great crowd tonight."

Commentss: India Women Won by Super Over
TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Women tour of India 2022
Comments: India Women Won by Super Over
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd WT20I between India and Australia. The two teams line up at the same venue where they played two days back, and the Women in Blue will look to bounce back and level the series, after a close contest in the previous encounter. Australia have had the upper hand in this fixture winning 19 of the 26 games, but India were the last team to beat Australia across formats and skipper Harmanpreet and team will look to break the Australian team's winning streak yet again tonight.


Ahead of tonight's game there was an injury update from the Australian side with left arm spinner Jess Jonassen missing out from the series and Amanda-Jade Wellington replacing her in the squad

TOSS:-
Harmanpreet Kaur has called it right at the toss and India will field first.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "We are gonna bowl first. In night games it is always better to chase because of the dew. Today, we are bowling first so we don't have to worry about defending like the last game. Same XI"

 

Alyssa Healy, Australia Skipper: "Not too fussed about losing the toss. The wicket is a bit dry so a good chance to bat first and get a good score. Well look to score about 185, that would be about par on this track. Well look to defend that with our bowling. We have two debutants  Phoebe Litchfield and Heather Graham for today's game."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 46/1 (7.7 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) || India- 55/0 (9.2 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 88/0 (9.8 rpo, 14x4, 1x6) || India- 78/2 (8.7 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 53/0 (10.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || India- 54/3 (10.8 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)

Wow, what a historic match this is!! India seals the match in their first-ever super over they have been part of! India won the toss and elected to bowl first. The Australian opener Beth Mooney(82* off 54) played stunningly along with Tahlia McGrath(70* off 51) as they partnered for 158* runs. The score at the end of 20 overs was 187 runs. In reply, the Indian batters Smriti Mandhana(79 off 49) and Shafali Verma(34 off 23) set up the chase by scoring 55 runs in the powerplay! Richa Ghosh who played an innings full of crackling shots took the team close to the target and with 5 runs to win in the final delivery, Devika Vaidya smacked a boundary which led to the first-ever super over to be faced by the Indian women.

 

In the super over, Richa Ghosh and Smriti Mandhana opened and Heather Graham took over the ball. The super over was ignited with a maximum on the first ball by Richa after which Smriti continued her touch in the remaining deliveries as she struck 13* runs in 3 balls. With a huge task of chasing 21 runs in the super over, Renuka Singh was given the ball. The skipper Alyssa Healey tried her best to take the team over the line but it was the Indian team who held their nerve and bagged the match!

 With this Victory, India becomes the first team to beat Australia in T20Is, this year!

 

Alyssa Healy, Australia Captain: "Missed a bit with the ball tonight and they cashed in. What a great advertisement for women's cricket this has been, with forty thousand people here tonight. We did well to hang in there in the end and get it to the Super Over, India were all over us in that chase. We fought well to get us to that position."

 

Smriti Mandhana is the Player of the Match

Smriti Mandhana: "I think everyone in the Indian team enjoys chasing. We also need to work on setting totals though. When they were batting, I realised it was an amazing wicket, I had my eyes on a big score. Didn't want to make the same mistake as the last innings. Happy to see such wickets prepared for women's cricket, you'll get high scores, high run chases."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur,  India Captain: "We kept backing ourselves. We learnt a lot from the previous game. If someone could get a bit more, then we could have got even 200. So that was the plan today, to back ourselves. I was always backing Richa, even when she wasn't getting runs. Today we saw what we could do with her power hitting. Fielding is something we need to keep working at, we gave too many runs today. Bowling was better today, because this wicket was too easy to bat on, nothing for the bowlers."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Women tour of India 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
After two close encounters at the DY Patil Stadium, the action shifts to the Brabourne Stadium on Wednesday as India and Australia gear up for the 3rd WT20I of the 5-match series. The Women in Blue bounced back and leveled the series in the last game, handing Australia their first loss in the format this year, in front of a full house at Navi Mumbai in a nerve-wracking Super Over finish. Harmanpreet and team will look to ride the momentum and take the lead in the series tonight in front of another packed crowd in Mumbai.

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Kirby Short: "A red soil wicket and we can expect good carry and bounce. It is a high-scoring ground. the teams batting first, need close to 200 runs."

 

RECORD ALERT:-
Harmanpreet Kaur is set to play her 140th WT20I and is on course to become the most capped Women's player in WT20I's!

 

TOSS:-

Harmanpreet Kaur has called it right for the second time in a row and India will once again field first!

 

One change for India as Rajeshwari Gayakwad comes in for Meghna Singh. The visitors have made 3 changes as Grace Harris, Nicola Carey, and Darcie Brown replace Phoebe Litchfield, Heather Graham, and Kim Garth respectively.
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 43/2 (7.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || India - 41/2 (6.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 84/2 (9.3 rpo, 7x4, 4x6) || India - 72/3 (8.0 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 45/4 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) || India - 38/2 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

 

Australia bounce back and win by 21 runs in the 3rd WT20I to take a 2-1 lead in the series! After winning the toss and opting to field, India got off to the perfect start with the new ball, picking up two wickets in the first two overs to put pressure on the visitors, after which a counter-attacking knock from Ellyse Perry and a quickfire 41 from Grace Harris helped Australia post 172 on board. In the chase, Shafali Verma took India off to a flyer and stitched a 50-run partnership with skipper Harmanpreet Kaur, but wickets in regular intervals for Australia helped them defend their total and win by 21 runs.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Skipper: "The way Anjali and Devika took the responsibility with the ball was outstanding to watch. Very impressed with the way they are bowling. After restricting them to 170-odd runs, we really thought we can chase this total. We played too many dot balls in the middle. After getting a boundary, our plan was to rotate strike but it didn't happen. Shafali or I knew one of us needs to play till the end."

 

Alyssa Healy, Australian Skipper: "We pride ourselves on the middle order and the damage they can do. Our bowlers did a great job to hang in there and defend the total. Definitely thought I dropped the game there when Harmanpreet ran past it. Rough start for Brown but the way she bounced back was brilliant, stuck to her strengths, attacked the stumps, and used the short ball. The impact that Grace Harris has is remarkable. Proud of the batting group and the bowling group."

 

Ellyse Perry is the Player of the Match

Ellyse Perry: "Nice to get an opportunity tonight. Grace was exceptional with such a quickfire innings. I really enjoy any opportunity to play for Australia. One of the coolest parts of that is the challenge to improve. Great crowd to play in front of."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Women tour of India 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the fourth T20I match between India and Australia at Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai. In the five-match WT20I series, the first match ended in the favour of Australia after which the Indian women made a comeback in the second match by winning the thriller in the super over. Australia again won the third match and they lead the T20I series 2-1! It is a must-win game for India to take the series alive to the final one on Tuesday. Will India bag the match and take the result to the ultimate match or will Australia turn victorious and seal the series today? 

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Captain: "It's always good to chase in the night games. As there's grass on the wicket and our seamers are doing well, we want to keep doing the same. I think in our side, everybody has the ability to hit sixes and we want to back ourselves. One change - Harleen Deol replaces Rajeshwari Gayakwad"

 

Alyssa Healy, Australia Captain: "We would have probably had a bowl but batting first worked last time so we are happy. I think we absorbed the pressure they put on us and we took wickets regularly so we want to do more of that. Holding our catches in this really long boundary is important for us. Heather Graham returns in place of Nicola Carey"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 42/1 (7.0 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || India- 44/2 (7.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 97/1 (10.8 rpo, 7x4, 4x6) || India- 86/2 (9.6 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 66/1 (13.2rpo, 7x4, 4x6) || India- 51/1 (9.6 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

 

An absolute run fest today in Brabourne but the visitors got the better of the hosts by whiskers! After winning the toss and choosing to bowl first, the women in blue picked up 2 wickets in quick succession, containing Australia to 70/2 in the first 10 overs. That's when Ellyse Perry and Ashleigh Gardner decided to take charge and accelerate the innings. They had a partnership of 94 in 59 balls. Grace Harris helped Australia end the innings on a high note and helped them post a mammoth total of 188. Having a massive task ahead, the women in blue started off well but ended up losing 3 wickets before the end of 7 overs. That's when Harmanpreet Kaur stepped in and played a captain's knock of 46 in 30, putting up a partnership of 72 runs with Devika Vaidya. Richa Ghosh came up with a few big blows in the death overs but unfortunately, India fell a little short. Alana King and Ashleigh Gardner were the picks of the Australian bowlers with 2 wickets each! Australia now wins the 5-match series, after winning 3 out of 4 games.

 

India captain, Harmanpreet Kaur: "I think we were in the game throughout but just one over here or there can make the difference. Yes definitely, if I were there till the end things would have been different. But still, after I got out I had faith in Deepti and Richa. I think the 18th over where we scored just three runs was what made the difference. I think all the young girls who got to play against this Aussie side got a lot of experience. I am really proud of how we bowled in the first 10 overs. We won a lot of areas today and I am really proud of that. [On not bowling] I picked up an injury during Asia Cup, so just batting right now."

 

Australia stand-in captain, Tahlia Mcgrath: "Very last-minute, thrown into captaining. But couldn't be prouder of this team. Yeah, new to the role and thrown into the deep end, but have had some help. The bowlers all stuck to their plans. New wicket, played reasonably similarly and produced some turn, but really good wicket. Calf strain, Alyssa's with the medical team, we'll see how she goes."

 

Ashleigh Gardner is the player of the match.

Ashleigh Gardner: "I think every single pitch we have played on while here in India has been fantastic to play on. I just think it was really crucial what lengths you bowl. I know if you pitch it up, it's easier to hit straight down the ground. So I was just bowling it into the ground. It's important to be able to mix up your lengths. I know T20 cricket is quite batter friendly and everyone just assumes that when you come to India there will be lot of spin, but in this format, you don't expect much turn."

TossDetails: India Women won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Women tour of India 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the fifth and final match of the T20 series between India and Australia at Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai.  Australia sealed the series 3-1, but both the teams displayed some amazing brand of cricket throughout the days. All the matches were high scoring and both the teams played very hard till the end to claim victory. However, it was Australia who were better than the hosts. Will India win the final match of the year and step into the next series with positive momentum or will Australia continue their streak? Will we see new faces today for the match?... Let's wait and watch!

Alyssa Healey is injured and the Australian team will be led by Tahlia McGrath!

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We are bowling first. Because of the weather, dew will be there. We played really well in the last game. Today we are going with an extra spinner and I think that'll help to stop the runs. We wanted to play free cricket and keep improving day by day. Once change - Jemima goes out and Rajeshwari Gayakwad comes in"

 

Tahlia McGrath, Australian Captain: "We were gonna have a bowl as well. Gives me a lot of confidence, I've come on the back of captaining six weeks straight. We want to win every game we play, so nothing changes tonight. One area we are looking to improve is our fielding. Kim Garth and Pheobe Litchfield are in for today's game."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 42/2 (7.0 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || India- 46/2 (7.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 87/2 (9.7 rpo, 10x4, 3x6) || India- 54/5 (6.0 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 67/0 (9.8 rpo, 9x4, 2x6) || India- 42/3 (8.4 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

 

 

And the series finally comes to an end with Australia winning the final match here and sealing the series 4-1! India won the toss and again chose to bowl and the Indian bowlers took two crucial wickets within the powerplay and kept the opposition in charge, after which A Gardner(66* off 32) and G Harris(64* off 35) played explosively well and partnered for 129* runs off just 62 deliveries. This led the team to a massive total of 196 runs. The Australian bowlers continued their momentum with the ball and dismissed the openers within the powerplay. Harleen Deol played a cameo of 24 runs off 16! Towards the end, the never-dying striking off Deepti Sharma brought India hope but it was Australia who ended well!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captian: "I think we were really good in the first ten overs. We know the kind of power they have in their game, but unfortunately, we weren't able to stop them. A Lot of learnings for us. We knew the type of cricket they play, happy to have improved though in a lot of areas. Self-belief has been the biggest positive in this series. We have a month off now where we'd like to train hard before the World Cup."

 

Tahlia McGrath, Australia captain: "It's always a fierce battle against India, and this series didn't disappoint. The power game is impressive to watch, loved watching Ashleigh and Grace today. We pride ourselves on fearless cricket. The crowds have been the best thing about the series, India came hard at us."

 

Ash Gardner is the Player of the Match and Player of the series.

Ash Gardner: "Just enjoying my cricket more than anything else, reaping the benefits on the field. I think it's easy batting with someone like Grace, who has the power game to back up the chat. I've just enjoyed my cricket over the last 12 months."

CompetitionName: Womens T20I Tri-Series In South Africa 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 1st match of the Tri-Series taking place between India, South Africa being the hosts and the West Indies. India is taking on the hosts South Africa in this first encounter at the Buffalo park stadium, East London. A total of 7 matches will be played in this series, including the finals. In 2020, right before the T20 world cup, India played a tri-series in Australia. This time, similarly, continuing the practice for the T20 World Cup in South Africa starting next month. Smriti Mandhana will be leading the Indian team today due to the absence of Harmanpreet Kaur who is out due to sickness and the hosts will be led by Sune Luus. These two sides met last time in 2022 where the Proteas sealed the series 2-1 against the Women in Blue in India. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD :-

India women and South Africa women have faced each 12 times in this format and India clearly have the upper hand winning 8 out of those 12 encounters. 

 

TOSS:-

South Africa won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 29/1 (4.8 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 30/2 (5.0 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 64/4 (7.1 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 56/3 (6.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 54/1 (10.8 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 34/4 (6.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

A comfortable and convincing win for India today. 148 was always going to be a tough chase owing to the slowness of this Pitch. India did get off to a shaky start but managed to pull back very well towards the end thanks to a magical innings by the debutant Amanjot ( 41* off 30 balls ) and the senior pro Deepti ( 33 off 23 balls ). In return, South Africa had a few batters who got off to starts, including their captain Sune Luus ( 29 off 30 balls ) but none could convert them into a big match winning score. Deepti led the bowling attack with three wickets while Vaidya picked up two, with Gayakwad, Rana and Radha chipping in with a wicket each. 

 

Amanjot Kaur is the Player of the Match

Amanjot Kaur: "I was very happy to contribute to the team's win. Never thought I'd be playing like this, glad that I grabbed the chance. Was just thinking of scoring runs. Deepti calmed my nerves, it was my debut, and she guided me well. Told asked me to just rotate the strike and bat deep."

 

Sune Luus, South Africa captain :- "I think we pulled it back nicely but then lost our way in the death overs. Deepti played very well. We needed some set batters to go deep but it just didn't happen. Still a long way to go."

 

Smriti Mandhana, India Captain :- "We spoke before the match that we need to show our character and the team did that. Partnership between Amanjot and Deepti was really good to watch. Our bowlers did their job on this pitch. With the start we got, we thought of getting to 120-130, but the batting they did got us about 15 more, credits to them. It's a dry surface and our spinners believed they could do the job."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Womens T20I Tri-Series In South Africa 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I match for India in the Tri-series where they lock horns against the West Indies at Buffalo Park, East London. Each team will play twice against each other and India which already played against South Africa will face West Indies today. The Indian Women kicked off the series with a victory against the hosts and the South African team came back with a comfortable win against West Indies. Will India win today's match and qualify straight to the final one or will the Windies win today and make all the teams level? Will Harmanpreet Kaur and the other unfit players make a comeback here or will the Indian squad be led by Smriti Mandhana with the same XI? Let's wait and watch to get the answers!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and West Indies have clashed against each other 18 times in T20Is and India has won 10 matches with the opposition claiming 8 victories! Will India raise their positive head-to-head tally or will the WIndies narrow down the numbers?

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 37/1 (6.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || West Indies- 25/2 (4.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 66/1 (7.3 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || West Indies- 56/1 (6.2 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 64/0 (12.8 rpo, 10x4, 1x6) || West Indies- 30/1 (6.0 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

 

With a margin of 56 runs, India wins the match and are at the top of the table with two victories in two matches! After opting to bat first, the Indian batters started slow and steady with 60 runs in the first ten overs. Vice Captain Smriti Mandhana(74* off 51) and the Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur(56* off 35) accelerated further partnering for 115* runs of just 70 balls and scoring 107 runs in the second half of the innings which led the team to a total of 167 runs. With the ball, Deepti Sharma picked two early wickets within the powerplay and built pressure. S Campbelle(47 off 57) and S Gajnabi(34* off 29) changed their gears after drinks in the tenth over but the target was too high to chase in the end and India seals the match!

 

Hayley Matthews, West Indies Skipper: "We did not have a positive intent and failed to rotate strike. Campbelle and I had a chat and decided to get going. The Indian batters played really well and the drop chances proved costly. We have to improve our game and step up for the next crucial game."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "We didn't want to hurry with the bat at any cost, and keeping wickets gives you confidence. We have to bat really well on these pitches where runs are not easy to get. Smriti batted well and so it was easy for me to hit. I was not available for the previous match and I am happy to make runs today."

 

Smriti Mandhana is the Player of the Match

Smriti Mandhana: "I think the wicket was similar. But after the first game we understood our mistakes and learned how to bat on that wicket. That's what we discussed and we did not want to go hard in the first few overs and that's what the team expected from me. When Harmanpreet came out it became easy to make that score"

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Womens T20I Tri-Series In South Africa 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second fixture between India and South Africa in the Tri-Series at Buffalo Park, East London. The Indian team is leading the table beating both the opponents South Africa and West Indies in the first faceoff. When the last time these two teams clashed, India won the match comfortably by 27 runs. Will the hosts retaliate in this match and gain the throne or will the Women in Blue continue their unbeaten streak in the series?

 

TOSS:-

Harmanpreet Kaur calls right and chooses to pick the bat first!
PostMatchCommentary: The Match has been called off and both the teams have been awarded a point and the two teams are qualified for the finals! Before this duo clashes for the finals, India will face West Indies on Monday!

Commentss: India Women U19 Won by 7  Wickets (Winners)

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Womens T20I Tri-Series In South Africa 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the Tri-Series match between India and the West Indies at Buffalo Park, East London. The teams played here to get through the final on Thursday for which India and South Africa got qualified already. West Indies appeared and experienced only losses in their three matches and today they will play their last match in this series. This fixture could be helpful for the Indian team to try new players and enter the final fixture with positive momentum if they win here. Will the benched players get a chance today?

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
India maintains their unbeaten streak in the series and enters the final as the topper of the table! This victory would give a lot of confidence to the team as they have performed pleasingly in all the departments of the game. As India batted first in all their fixtures this series, the skipper Harmanpreet opted to bowl first. Deepti Sharma was the star with the ball as she picked three wickets in total in which the first two were successive ones. The approach was controlled by the batters and the run flow was minimal. The WI skipper H Matthews fought well and made 34 runs. With a low target of 95 runs to chase, the opener J Rodrigues struck 42* runs along with the Skipper Harmanpreet(32* off 23). The finals will be played between India and South Africa on Thursday!

 

Hayley Matthews, West Indies Captain: "The way Shamilia Connell is bowling is a big positive for us. It is nice to see a few Under-19 players make their debut. There has been good energy in the team and really happy to have them. Having some options is always nice. Cricket is a sport where anything can happen on the day. We just have to believe that we will turn things in our favor."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "I think we bowled well but still I feel we could have done better than this. Amount of bowling we have we were looking to restrict them to under 80 but anyway we will take it in a positive way. I think it's a great positive when you have too many options and you have to keep thinking about what is your best eleven and the next game will be a great opportunity for us to try the final eleven. The way Jemimah played was very impressive and I am happy that I could score too."

 

Deepti Sharma is the Player of the Match 

Deepti Sharma: "The captain, and everyone have faith on me. I practiced a lot to bowl in the powerplay and coming at the end of the innings. They are supporting me and that's what gives me confidence. I really don't feel pressure. I just enjoy it whenever I get to bowl."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Womens T20I Tri-Series In South Africa 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the finale of the Tri-series 2023 where India and South Africa lock horns at Buffalo Park, East London. India was unbeaten in the series and dominated well throughout. With the previous fixture between the duo being called off due to rain, there is no interruption today according to the weather reports! So, we have an exciting final waiting for us today. India will next play in the T20 WC in South Africa and this is no better chance to beat the hosts and carry the positive momentum to the main event. Will the hosts reply back with a win or the Indian team continue their streak? Who will be the one team which will lift the trophy tonight?

 

VENUE STATS:-

In the five full T20I matches taken place in this series at this venue, the teams batting first have won three and the teams chasing have won two fixtures. The average score at this venue has been recorded as 129/5. Will the teams opt to bat or bowl first?

 

TOSS:-

India wins the toss on a crucial final and elects to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 19/1 (3.2 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 19/2 (3.2 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 50/2 (5.5 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 63/3 (7.0 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 40/1 (8.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 31/0 (18 overs, 10.3 rpo, 1x4, 2x6) 

 

An all-important final of the Tri-series 2023 between India and South Africa has been won by the hosts by 5 wickets. India won the toss and opted to bat first. The pitch turned well and assisted the spinners. The team started slowly and lost early wickets. Harleen Deol played a sheet anchor role scoring 46 runs and the skipper also made 21 runs. But the total at the end of the innings was 109 runs. In the second innings, the Indian bowlers took early wickets but the unbeaten knock of C Tryon (57* off 32) guided the team to victory! Both the teams will now prepare for the T20 World Cup which is about to start in a very few days! Till that we sign off from here!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "It is fine but will take 2-3 days to recover. We enjoyed it and this is important. Plenty of positives in the series, we didn’t get over the line but our bowlers bowled very well. Looking forward to the WC."

 

Chloe Tryon is the Player of the Match

Chloe Tryon: "A great game and the bowlers did the job on a tough pitch. Happy to win the trophy. This win will give us a lot of confidence going forward to the World Cup. Very happy with this victory."

 

Deepti Sharma is the Player of the Series

Deepti Sharma: "I bowled according to the situation and I executed the plans as discussed in the meetings throughout the tournament. The ball was turning and it helped the spinners. We bowled well and I'm happy with my performance." 

 

Sune Luus, South Africa Skipper: "Very proud of the girls. This will give us confidence going forward and looking to the World Cup. It was a turning track and all the bowlers did well! Tryon was great with that innings. The fielding is something that we pride ourselves on and the fielding coach will be happy for sure."

TossDetails: Pakistan (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Womens T20 World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the first match of Team India's campaign in the ICC T20 World Cup 2023 against Pakistan in Cape Town. The Women in Blue were runners-up in the previous edition of the T20 World Cup and will look to go one better this time and start their campaign with a win tonight. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side have had the upper hand in this fixture, winning 10 of the 13 matches played between the two sides, and India will look to continue the winning momentum.

 

VENUE REPORT:-

The Par Score in the venue in the 4 Women's T20I since 2016 leading up to the World Cup is 156. India had scored the highest score in this venue in these 4 matches, scoring 166 in 2018 and defended the target successfully. 

 

TOSS:-

Pakistan have won the toss and will bat first.

 

Bismah Maroof, Pakistan Skipper: "We'd like to bat first. It is a dry wicket, and won't change much so we'd like to put up a total. We have confidence because we won against India last time but conditions are different here."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Skipper: "We wanted to bat because these wickets are a bit tricky. Smriti will be fine but we have added an extra batter for today, Harleen comes in and Shikha Pandey misses out. I think these wickets will help us, we are a very good bowling side. Our bowlers performed well in the tri-series before as well."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Pakistan - 39/1 (6.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6) || India - 43/1 (7.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Pakistan - 52/3 (5.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India - 60/2 (6.7 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Pakistan - 58/0 (11.6 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || India - 48/0 (12.0 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

 

Another India-Pakistan thriller at a T20 World Cup with India clinching victory! The Women in Blue started with momentum and the bowlers kept building pressure, highlighted by a brilliant performance with the ball from Radha Yadav, after which a blistering end to the innings from Ayesha Naseem and Bismah Maroof took Pakistan to 149/4. In the chase, Shafali Verma helped India maximize the Powerplay and swung the momentum initially, after which a half-century from Jemimah Rodrigues and a firepower innings from Richa Ghosh helped India complete the 2nd highest chase at a T20 World Cup and start their campaign with a victory.

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India skipper: "It was a good game. Pakistan batted well and Jemi and Richa played really well. Very sensible batting from both of them. All the players are keen to do well for the team, and whoever gets the opportunity they are pushing themselves. It's a good sign for us and a win against Pakistan is always special. The crowd was also fantastic and got good support. We would love to spend some time in the nets and sort out the things we didn't do well today before the West Indies game. It's important to keep doing the right things in the nets too."

 

Bismah Maroof, Pakistan skipper: "We were in the game all the time, but they played really well. We made mistakes with the ball and will try to be better in the next game. The batters played their roles well. Ayesha was crucial for us with that knock."

 

Jemimah Rodrigues is the Player of the Match

Jemimah Rodrigues: "This innings is really special to me, I haven’t been getting runs for a while but I’ve stuck to the processes. God is grateful, he takes care of the rest. I want to dedicate this to my parents, they are here at the stadium, and this knock goes out to them. We were going over by over and we knew they would bowl a loose ball so that is what we had to punish. We knew we’d win if we stayed till the end. We’re very happy we’ve won this, momentum is on our side and now we just need to do the simple things correctly and consistently."

TossDetails: West Indies (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Womens T20 World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the second fixture of the Indian campaign in the ICC T20 World Cup where they lock horns with West Indies at Newlands, Cape Town. India kicked off their crusade with a triumph against its rivals Pakistan whereas their opponents West Indies suffered a loss against England. Both the teams would be well aware of their opponent's strengths and weaknesses as they just faced off against each other a few days back in the Tri-Series where India dominated WI. Who will win here on the biggest stage?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and West Indies have clashed against each other 20 times in T20Is and India has won 12 matches with the opposition claiming 8 victories! 

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Hayley Matthews, West Indies Skipper: "We will bat first. The last game didn't go too badly. We would look to get better off the opposition by playing our brand of cricket. We have one change in the XI."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Skipper: "We wanted to bat because last game we chased. Today, the wicket looks better. We have Smriti back who loves to chase and Devika's back on the side. So I think it's quite a balanced side and we are looking forward. It's good for us playing a couple of games recently against them and we know them very well and we want to give our best and continue what we did in the last game."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

West Indies- 29/1 (4.8 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || India- 41/2 (6.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

West Indies- 53/3 (5.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || India- 57/1 (6.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

West Indies- 36/2 (7.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || India- 21/1 (6.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

 

India wins back-to-back fixtures in the T20 World Cup and are placed top second on the table. India were forced to bowl first by West Indies and the bowlers did a pretty good job! After a loss of a wicket in the second over, the West Indies batters Stafanie Taylor(42 off 40) and Shemaine Campbelle(30 off 36) steadied the ship by partnering for 73 runs. Deepti Sharma was given the ball in the 14th over and provided the breakthrough with these two crucial wickets in that over. The score at the end of the innings was 118 runs. With less target to defend, the West Indian bowlers bowled well and picked two wickets in the powerplay but the usual explosive innings from Shafali Verma(28 off 23) took the team to a decent run rate. After the wicket of Shafali, the Indian skipper Harmanpreet Kaur(33 off 42) and Richa Ghosh(44* off 32) provided a stand and steered the team to victory by 6 wickets.

 

Deepti Sharma is the Player of the Match

Deepti Sharma: "I am feeling good. We were able to apply what we discussed in the meeting. I am happy with the achievement of being the first Indian to take 100 T20I wickets. I am focusing on the rest of the games. There was a bit of turn in this surface and I focused on bowling stump to stump."

 

Shemaine Campbelle, West Indies Vice Captain: "We didn't get enough runs as much as we were hoping. We should have got 150 and that would have been a fighting total. The top three batters have to bat till the end. Ramharack has been bowling pretty good for some time, it was a good spell."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India captain: "It was a great day. We did what we wanted and bowled well. Richa and Deepti have been great to us. Richa is someone who can pull the game for us and we are really happy that she is in that touch. We are happy with the two results and want to continue this rhythm."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Womens T20 World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the ICC Women's T20 World Cup between India and England. The Women in Blue head into this encounter on the back of two consecutive victories and a win here tonight will ensure a place in the Semi-Finals for the Indian side. England too step into this vital contest with two wins and would want to take the winning momentum into the knock-out stage of the tournament. It will be a cracker of a contest between two sides that are unbeaten in the tournament so far.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and England have played each other 26 times and 7 of the matches have been won by the Women in Blue. The last major encounter between the sides took place in the commonwealth Games where Team India defeated England women in the semi-finals.

 

TOSS:-

India Women have won the toss and have elected to field first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

England - 37/3 (6.2 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India - 40/1 (6.7 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

England - 69/1 (7.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || India - 53/2 (5.9 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

England - 45/3 (9.0 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) || India - 47/2 (9.4 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

 

India falls short by 11 runs in their third group game against England in the ICC Women's T20 WC 2023. After winning the toss and opting to field, India got off to the perfect start with the ball, picking up three wickets inside the Powerplay courtesy of some brilliant new ball bowling from Renuka, who later went on to register her maiden 5-wicket haul in International cricket, and a fighting half-century from Nat Sciver-Brunt ensured that England put on 151 on the board. In the chase, Smriti Mandhana got India off to a flyer in the Powerplay and registered her 7th half-century against England in WT20I, but a clinical performance from the English spinners helped them defend their target. India are back in action in just two days at the same venue against Ireland for their last group game. Follow us then!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India skipper: "We started really well but in the middle overs we didn't bowl according to plan and gave away too many runs and lost the momentum. We were doing well with the bat but didn't get the run rate that we were looking for and that's why we lost wickets. Whenever Renuka's bowling we are looking for wickets and she's someone who enjoys her spell, good to see her doing so well. We did well in patches but there are some areas we need to work on."

 

Heather Knight, England skipper: "We talk a lot about trying to fit our mindset to the conditions and that partnership between myself and Nat was the key. Nat steadied the innings really well and then Amy was outstanding. It shows our batting depth, and even after losing three wickets, we can put up a good score. Renuka was outstanding and was nipping the ball both ways, but keeping a positive mindset helps to manipulate the field. We haven't played against a big team recently and to go out and play like that was really good. Our ground fielding was outstanding and the best so far. We dropped a couple of catches but that can happen in these big games."

 

Nat Sciver-Brunt is the Player of the Match

Nat Sciver-Brunt: "It was tough, the Indian bowlers were getting it to seam a lot, Renuka got five wickets and bowled brilliantly. We had to soak it up a little bit but make sure we put our foot forward and take the attack on as well. We didn't get the start we wanted but we were good in the middle overs and ensured we kept going for the boundaries. It was great to have atmosphere like that."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Womens T20 World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a welcome to the final league stage match of the Indian campaign in the ICC T20 World Cup where they square off against Ireland at St George's Park, Gqeberha. India won their first two fixtures and suffered their first loss against England lastly at this same stadium whereas their opponents Ireland have not won a match in this World Cup. If India gains a victory here, they will qualify directly to the Semi-Finals or India should keep an eye on the Net Run Rates of the other teams. Can India seal their spot today or will Ireland be the party spoilers?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Ireland have clashed against each other only once in 2018 and India registered a comfortable 52-run victory!
 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Captain: "We will bat first. Looks a hard and dry surface. Many of us haven't got that many runs, we need to express ourselves. Radha is unfortunately not well and Devika Vaidya replaces her. It means a lot (To become the first Indian player to play 150th WT20I match). Thanks to BCCI and ICC, we are able to play so many games."

 

Laura Delany, Ireland Captian: "We have to put in our best performance and need to stick to the process. The pressure is on India. The players have shown what they are capable and the energy is good in the camp. We have a change - Georgina is in for Maguire."
PostMatchCommentary:
With the rain being the spoilsport today, the Indian team has won the match by 5 wickets by DLS Method!! India also qualifies for the semi-final of the ICC T20 World Cup and this is their third consecutive entry into the semis! The team would step into the knockouts with a positive momentum here as there were a lot of positives today. Smriti Mandhana got her highest WT20I score of 87 runs and received the player of the match award!! Let us all tune in for the semi-final on Thursday where India squares off against Australia!!

 

 

Smriti Mandhana is the Player of the Match

Smriti Mandhana: "One of the toughest innings I would have played in terms of the pace at what they were bowling at this pitch. It got worse with the wind. Real hard work for the first 30 balls, I thought I had forgotten how to bat. Once you start middling, you'll start hitting well. It's good to score a few runs and go into the Semifinals. The team is also looking really well."

 

Laura Delany, Ireland captain: "Rain came out of nowhere. We were preparing for wind and we just tried to build a partnership but it got our way. We want to improve on our fielding, it has overall been a very positive experience."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India captain: "It was a good game for us. Smriti got runs, which is very important for us. Just wanted to go up and spend some time in the middle, since I haven't really got that so went up at number 3. Means a lot to get into the semis and we will give our hundred percent. We always enjoy our match against Australia."

TossDetails: Australia (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Womens T20 World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the Semi-Final game of the ICC T20 Women's World Cup, 2023 between India and Australia. The two teams head into the game with a win in their previous encounters. Women in Blue have won three out of their four group encounters while Team from Australia has won all their four group stage games. Smriti Mandhana has been the top performer with the bat for India with 149 runs at a staggering average of 49.67 whereas Allysa Healy has been in good form scoring 146 runs at an average of 73. Looking at the bowling side of things, Renuka Thakur has been lethal with the new ball and has provided the start that Team India will look forward to in this vital semi-final encounter against a formidable Australian line-up. Although Australia is a favorite heading into the match, India possesses all the goods to create an upset at a stage where it matters the most. One can expect a cracker of a contest at Newlands, Cape town between two sides which has some exciting talent in the line-up.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Australia have clashed 30 times in which Team Australia has 22 games to their credit while Women in Blue have registered 7 victories! 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ian Bishop: "It looks like a fresh pitch and the dimensions seem short on one side of the ground. The same pitch will be used for tomorrow as well for the other semi-finals. It's a nice, healthy green patch and it's in the line of middle and off-stump. The batters would look to target the shorter boundaries and use it to their advantage."

 

 

TOSS:-

Australia won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Meg Lanning, Australia Captian: "We are gonna have a bat. Looks a pretty good wicket,  As usual we get out here and see what it is doing and adjust accordingly.

Conditions are really good so get out there and have some fun. Jess Jonassen comes in for Alana King and Alyssa Healy is back for Annabel Sutherland". 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Skipper: "Pooja Vastrakar is unwell and misses out, so Sneh Rana is replacing her and in place of Rajeshwari Gayakwad Radha Yadav comes in. Another change is that Yastika comes in for Devika. I was unwell but feeling better now. One thing that we have been discussing throughout the tournament that we have to bat well that's why we added one more batter. "
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 43/0 (7.1 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) ||  India- 59/3 (9.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) 

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 70/2 (7.7 rpo, 9x4, 0x6) ||  India- 75/2 (8.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) 

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 59/2 (11.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6) ||  India- 33/3 (6.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) 

 

A contest worthy of being a semi-final. Australia elected to bat first after winning the toss. Beth Mooney 54 of 37 and Meg Lanning 49 of 34 balls were the top scorers for the Aussies. A quick-fire 31 of just 18 balls helped the Aussies reach a competitive total of 172. Deepti Sharma was the most economical of the Indian bowlers conceding 7.50 r.p.o. In response, India did not get the desired start but Jemimah Rodrigues and Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur stitched together a 69-run partnership of 41 balls to get India back on track. Kaur made 52 of 34 balls before getting run out in the most unlucky manner after which the tide turned in Australia's favor. India was cruising on at a point in time but the spell from Darcie Brown that got the wicket of Jemimah Rodrigues proved to be crucial in the end. The fast bowler bowled four overs conceding just 18 runs and accounted for three dismissals. Heartbreak for India but one has to give it to the fighting spirit of the Women in blue who put up an inspiring performance losing by a very narrow margin of five runs.

 

Ashleigh Gardener is the Player of the Match

 

Ashleigh Gardener: "Just shows the way we play and fight as a team, and that's what we kind of spoke about in the team huddle right at the end. We probably weren't in a winning position and that's when this team does best. When our backs are up against the wall, we find a way and we scrap really hard and that's what we did today with the ball."

 

Meg Lanning, Australia Captian: "One of the best wins I have been involved in. To fight back from well behind and win despite not playing our best cricket. Great fighting spirit from the girls, couldn't be more proud of them.  India came hard at us and they have got some incredible players. Came right down to the wire and we had to seize those clutch moments which is exactly what we did. Found a way out when the situation was not in our favour". 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Skipper: "Can't be unluckier than this, to get that momentum back when I and Jemimah were batting. And to lose after that partnership was totally unexpected. The way I got runout, can't be unluckier than that. Putting in the effort was more important. We discussed fighting till the last ball butThe result didn't go our way. I am happy with the way we played in this tournament. "
