TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the first T20 between Bangladesh Women and India Women. The tour consists of three T20s and three ODIs between the two Asian giants. The Women in Blue have had the better of the hosts in terms of the head-to-head record against Bangladesh, having won 11 out of 13 T20Is played between the teams. It will be interesting to see how the Harmanpreet Kaur led side adjusts to the conditions in Dhaka against a formidable unit in their own backyard.  

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India Women and Bangladesh Women have clashed 13 times in which India has 11 games to their credit while the hosts Bangladesh has just managed to win 2 matches.

 

TOSS:-

India Women won the toss and elected to first!

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "We will field first. The pitch looks hard, but we don't have much idea how it will play. We will look to bowl wicket-to-wicket, looking for breakthroughs early on.  We want to play free cricket and enjoy ourselves. We have two debutants in our side. Important is that We need to come out here and execute our plans".

 

Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "I think it is a decent track to bat on. Need a good total in these conditions. Looking at their batting line-up, we need a score over 140. We have one debutant in the team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Bangladesh Women- 34/1 (5.7 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)  ||  India Women- 41/2 (6.9 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) 

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Bangladesh Women- 42/2 (4.7 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  ||  India Women- 64/1 (7.1 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) 

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Bangladesh Women- 38/2 (7.6 rpo, 0x4, 2x6)  ||  India Women- 13/0 (10.8 rpo, 1x4, 1x6) 

 

A good start to the series for the Women in Blue. India restricted the run flow in the powerplay after winning the toss and asking Bangladesh to bat first. The spinners did an excellent job in the middle overs giving nothing away to the batting side. Bangladesh managed only 42 runs in the over slab 9-15 and also lost two crucial wickets. To defend a score of 115 was never going to be easy going against a strong Indian batting unit. Although Shafali Verma got out in the first over, Smriti Mandhana made sure that runs kept flowing from the other end. A 70 run stand between Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur took the game away from the hosts with very little scope of a comeback. Mandhana scored 38 while Kaur remained unbeaten on 54 taking the team home in the 17 over of the game.

 

Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "The bowlers did a decent job.  There were a lot of dot balls while we batted. Need to work on that. Looking forward to the next match."

 

Player of the Match: Smriti Mandhana

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "We were able to execute our plans. Overall it was a great performance by our team. I think Deepti Sharma did well showing her experience. Smriti Mandhana showed her character today, with that batting line-up you don't need to worry much. We wanted to finish with 4-5 overs left, and we managed to do that".

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the second T20 between Bangladesh Women and India Women. After a convincing win in the first T20, Harmanpreet Kaur and Co. would be looking to clinch the series in this match while it would be interesting to see how the home team bounces back after a dismal performance in the series opener. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India Women and Bangladesh Women have clashed 14 times in which India has 12 games to their credit while the hosts Bangladesh has just managed to win 2 matches.

 

TOSS:-

India Women won the toss and elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India Women- 37/3 (6.1 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  ||  Bangladesh Women- 21/2 (3.5 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India Women- 28/3 (3.1 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)  ||  Bangladesh Women- 45/3 (5.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India Women- 30/2 (6.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  ||  Bangladesh Women- 21/5 (4.2 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) 

 

India got off to a decent start after electing to bat first but lost its way thereafter. India Losing three wickets in a matter of 6 balls tilted the momentum in Bangladesh's favor. Bangladesh Spinners gave nothing away in the middle overs picking three wickets for just 28 runs. It was never going to be easy defending 96 but the Indian bowlers started well in the powerplay conceding at less than 4 r.p.o and accounting for two dismissals. But Captain Nigar Sultana kept scoring from one end which kept the home team in contention. It was Deepti Sharma who got the big wicket of Sultana while Shafali Verma did the damage at the back end. India Women came out victorious defending 10 of the last over. 

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "It is a part of the game, sometimes your plan fails but in the second innings we showed our character. Credit to all our bowlers, they were bowling under pressure but they did well, and also the fielders. In this tournament, we have a couple of young bowlers who are gonna take the responsibility and it's important to show trust in them.  All of them took responsibility and did exceedingly well".

 

Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "Restricting India below 100 is a great job by the bowlers. But the batters needed to finish the job. Including me I should have ended the game. We did not get the start we wanted and in cricket, we should move on and look forward to the next game."

 

Player of the Match Deepti Sharma

Deepti Sharma: "I really enjoyed this kind of pitch where there is assistance for the spinners. My plan was just to bowl according to the situation, and bowl more dot balls. We told everyone to keep calm and think about the process. Whatever we do, we have to do it with confidence. Everyone did well as a team and whenever I get the opportunity with the bat, I want to do well."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third T20 between Bangladesh Women and India Women. Women in Blue having won the previous two and the series already would look to give some time in the middle to the newly inducted youngsters while the home team that did bowl well in the second match have nothing to play for but pride.

 


HEAD TO HEAD:
The Women in Blue have a favorable head-to-head record against Bangladesh Women, having won 13 out of 15 T20Is played between the sides.

 

TOSS:-

Harmanpreet Kaur calls it right at the toss and India will bat first!

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "It's a tricky wicket and we are lucky to win the toss and bat first. We just need to play ball by ball and not think too much about other things, we will try and execute what we discussed. We have 2 changes. Devika and debut for Rashi Kanojiya."

 

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "Happy to bowl first, we just need to work on a few areas in our bowling department. We will try and restrict them to under 110. We have one change. Dilara comes in".
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India Women- 27/2 (4.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  || Bangladesh Women- 28/2 (4.7 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India Women- 59/1 (6.6 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || Bangladesh Women- 48/2 (5.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India Women- 16/6 (3.2 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)  || Bangladesh Women- 27/2 (8.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) 

 

Women in Blue have won the T20 series but the home team finally gets points in the win column! Bangladesh Women did well to get the openers in the powerplay and restrict India's scoring initially. Steady partnerships in the middle order brought India back in the game. Harmanpreet Kaur did well to score 40 from 41 balls. The death overs belonged to the Bangladeshi Spinners as they scalped 6 wickets conceding just 16 runs from the last 5. The momentum had clearly tilted towards the home team at the end of the first innings. Indian bowlers started well but a partnership of 46 (49) between Shamima Sultana and Skipper Nigar Sultana took the game away from the visitors. India did come back picking a few wickets at the backend but failed to defend a total of 103. 

 

Shamima Sultana is Player of the Match.

Shamima Sultana : "After the previous match we discussed in terms of what is going wrong and what is needed to be done. I am glad that I was able to execute my plans and everything came off well".

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women's Captain & Player of the series: "Bangladesh looked aware today, the way they were batting. Lots of learning to take from that. They did not give us a single chance to take the game. We need to stay positive and see what can be done. We did not apply ourselves, our batting collapsed as well. Scoring below six s unacceptable. Credit to their bowlers. We knew this will be a low-scoring tournament and that we would be needed to keep rotating the strike and focus on playing less number of dot balls. We need to set up long-term goals. Let's see how we plan the next three games."

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "We needed momentum, and today how we bowled, it is going to give us a lot of confidence. Bowlers showed their character and potential. After the last match, everyone was confident that we can upset a good side on a given day. We know what we are capable of.  I know my team's potential and the fact that we are capable of beating good teams."

TossDetails: India (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh Odi Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of India Women vs Bangladesh Women. The first of the three ODI series will take place at the Shere Bangla National Stadium, Dhaka which is also the venue for the other two matches to follow. After a good outing in the T20 format, Women in Blue would be looking to continue the winning momentum and maintain their unbeaten record against the hosts in the 50-Over format whereas the hometeam would be looking to build on the positives from the T20 series and play with intent this time around. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
The Women in Blue have an unbeaten 5 to Nil record against Bangladesh.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Syed Abid Hossain Sami: "This is the ODI series opener and we are having overcast conditions due to rain last night. There is little Grass cover but it's a tough surface. There will be lateral movement early on but eventually, it will be spinners that will come in handy."

 

TOSS:
Team India has won the toss and has elected to field first 

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "We are going to bowl first. Cloud cover and the conditions are such.It was raining when we arrived at the ground. Hopefully, our pacers will use this opportunity well. After a good T20 series, we are looking to play some good cricket again. Amanjot Kaur and B Anusha make their ODI debuts."

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "Winning momentum is very important and we are looking to play some positive Cricket. We have included some senior players to the side and we have one debutant Shorna Akter."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Bangladesh Women- 14/2 (1.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || India Women- 37/3 (3.7 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh Women- 128/6 (4.2 rpo, 12x4, 0x6)  || India Women- 76/7 (2.9 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-44 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh Women- 10/2 (3.3 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

It is the first time that Bangladesh Women have gone past Women in Blue in the ODI format. India started well after winning the toss and asking Bangladesh to bat first. The bowlers did an excellent job keeping the score to just 14 in the first ten overs and also accounting for 2 Top order wickets. Bangladeshi Skipper Nigar Sultana carried on from one end but lacked support from the other. She compiled 39 runs helping her team reach 152. Amanjot Kaur picking up 4 wickets in her debut game was the pick of the bowlers. Team India in response did not have the best of starts losing 3 wickets in the first 10 overs. Bangladeshi Spinners continued to apply pressure in the middle overs giving nothing away. Rabeya Khan bowled tight overs conceding at just 3.80 r.p.o and scalping three wickets. However, the major damage was done by Marufa Akter who got rid of both the openers as well as got two wickets of consecutive balls in the 29th over of the game. Deepti Sharma top scored with 20 but succumbed under pressure eventually. Bangladesh wins the match by 40 runs (D/L).

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "We failed to take responsibility while batting. In bowling also, we were not up to the mark. We don't have any issue with leg spin but sometimes some bowlers bowl very well. Overall we are not batting up to the mark and not bowling according to our strengths. We have done well in ODI cricket and we have to back ourselves to come back from this point."

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "In the first innings I think we were 30-40 runs short of what we wanted on board on this track. The lower-order batters gave us some vital runs. All credit to the bowlers, they assessed the wicket well and executed their plans to their best. Thank you to the crowd, they boosted the morale of the team. The thing was that we wanted to get early wickets. Our plan and execution worked for us."

 

 

Marufa Akter is the Player of the Match

Marufa Akter: "Our batters batted well. My target was to bowl in tight lines and contribute to my team. I bowled well initially and it was good that I gave the finishing touches as well. I am thankful to the crowd for their support."

TossDetails: Bangladesh (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh Odi Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of Match No.2 between Bangladesh Women and India Women. The hosts came out victorious in the previous outing registering their first-ever win in this format against the Women in Blue. Marufa Akter accounting for 4 and Rabeya Khan picking up 3 crucial wickets were instrumental in Bangladesh's Success. It is a must-win encounter for Team India in order to keep the series alive while the hometeam would be looking to continue their momentum and seal the series. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Team India   has come out victorious on 5 occasions while Bangladesh   has clinched 1 game from the 6 ODI clashes between the teams.

 

TOSS:
Bangladesh has won the toss and has elected to field first 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
There was cloud cover early on but the Sun is out now and the surface looks hard. We have seen low-scoring encounters between the two sides. Bangladesh managed to defend 150 runs in the previous game which says a lot about the surface. The team batting first would be happy with something around 200."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "Very important to back ourselves and play good cricket. In the last two matches, we didn't play to our strength. In our playing eleven, we have 2 changes. It is a fresh wicket and we hope it will play better than the previous one."


Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "It is a fresh wicket and our bowling can actually work here. We feel that we can chase down here. The team has always been like this but there is now some confidence after the last two matches. I am glad that we are playing well as a team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India Women- 40/1 (4.0 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || Bangladesh Women- 22/2 (2.2 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India Women- 121/2 (4.03 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || Bangladesh Women- 98/8 (3.9 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-44 Overs) :- 

India Women- 67/5 (6.7 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

 

India bounce back and keep the series alive after a dominating win over the hosts Bangladesh in the second ODI at the Shere Bangla Stadium in Dhaka. India got off to a decent start after being sent in by Bangladesh courtesy of Smriti Mandhana who got back to form scoring a well-composed 36. Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and Jemimah Rodrigues stitched together a brilliant partnership of 98 from 106 balls to put India in the driver's seat. Rodrigues top scored with 86 at a staggering strike rate of 110. A total of 228 was never going to be easy to chase on a slow and sluggish track at Dhaka. Indian bowlers gave nothing away in the powerplay bowling 4 maiden overs on the trot. Thereafter it was the Indian spinners that ran through the Bangladeshi middle order.  The Spin pair of Rodrigues and Devika Vaidya scalped 7 wickets between them conceding just 33 runs in 11 overs. The hosts lost their last 7 wickets for just 14 runs, falling short by 108 eventually. 

 

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women's Captain: "We wanted to bat and got that. It was a great opportunity for us to bat first and set up a good total on the board. We spoke about one of the batters batting till the end, when Jemimah came in we played according to the situation and the focus was on taking singles. We have been batting on flat tracks, played ODIs after a long time and hence were not able to adjust quickly, but we spoke about how to adjust and bat on these surfaces. It will be a good final in two days' time."

 


Nahida Akter, Bangladesh Women's Stand-in Captain: "The fielding was not up to the mark today and the bowling too did not click, we could not restrict them and India posted a good total. Bangladesh will look to overcome the hurdles and play better in the final ODI."

 

 

Jemimah Rodrigues is the Player of the Match

Jemimah Rodrigues: "I'd be lying to say that I wasn't under pressure, we saw how good the hosts were in the first match. But as a team, we spoke about how we can we bounce back after a loss. Harman and I were bating really well then Harleen came into the middle and gave us that extra push. I didn't try to do anything extra, just tried to pitch the ball in the right spots and allow the pitch to do the rest, credit to the team management for believing in my bowling."

TossDetails: Bangladesh (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Women Tour Of Bangladesh Odi Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of ODI No.3 between India Women vs Bangladesh Women. The hosts created history by going past Women in Blue in the first ODI of the series after which Team India bounced back by winning the second ODI comprehensively by 108 runs. A Cricket fan wanting a competitive series between two gritty sides could not have asked for a better finale to what has been an exciting series. It is now time for the series decider!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Team India has come out victorious on 6 occasions while Bangladesh has clinched 1 game from the 7 ODI clashes between the teams.

 


PITCH REPORT: 
Same pitch that was used in the first ODI where Bangladesh women went on to win the match. Can be another low-scoring encounter like we have seen in the series. The team batting first should see through the first ten overs and then look to play their shots. The team winning the toss should look to put some runs on the board.
 

 

TOSS:
Bangladesh has won the toss and has elected to Bat first 

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "We want to bat first. The reason is we had them under pressure in the chase, so want to have a score on the board. Two changes for us."

 

Harmanpreet Kaur, India Women Captain: "Probably we would have batted as well. We want to bat freely and take responsibility as well. We have got Shafali in place of Priya Punia."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Bangladesh Women- 32/0 (3.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || India Women- 59/2 (5.9 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh Women- 131/1 (4.36 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)  || India Women- 124/2 (4.1 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-44 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh Women- 62/3 (6.2 rpo, 5x4, 0x6) || India Women- 42/6 (4.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  

 

A match that could have gone either way ends up in a tie. As they say, in the end, it is Cricket that wins the contest. Bangladesh got off to a good start keeping all their wickets intact until the 26th over of the innings. A partnership of 93 between the two openers Shamima Sultana and Fargana Hoque set the platform for the hosts. Hoque was involved in another 71-run stand with the Skipper Nigar Sultana. Fargana Hoque created history by becoming the first Bangladeshi Batter to score a century in ODIs. In response to 225, Women in Blue lost Shafali Verma and Yastika Bhatia early in the innings but a 107-run stand between Smriti Mandhana and Harleen Deol had India in the driver's seat for the most part of the second innings. Smriti Mandhana scored 59 before falling to the leg spinner Fahima Khatun. Deol was going great guns from one end but an untimely dismissal in the form of a run out changed the course of the game. The 42nd over accounted for two run-outs and proved to be the turning point of the match. India was cruising along but lost 6 wickets in the last 10 overs failing to get over the line. Nevertheless it was a valiant effort to tie the game in this nail-biting encounter.

 

Fargana Hoque is the Player of the Series

 

 

Harleen Deol is Player of the Match

Harleen Deol: " It was a good wicket to bat. Initially, we were struggling because we didn't know the conditions that well. We were ahead of the game and unfortunately, we got out and then the game turned. But it is always good to have some runs under your belt."

 

Nigar Sultana, Bangladesh Women Captain: "It was a great match, we are getting a lot of experience which will help us. We thought we need 230-plus runs on this pitch. Fargana Hoque batted really well. We tried to enjoy the game and the fight from the team was unbelievable. After the break, we were discussing either they will come hard on us or we will go hard on them. The bowlers did a fantastic job. This is a good step for us for the future, to build a good side and hopefully, we can take things from here."

Harmanpreet Kaur, Indian Women's Captain: I think a lot of learning for us from this game. Even apart from the play, the kind of decisions from the umpires were surprising. The next time we travel to Bangladesh we will make sure we had to deal with this kind of umpiring and prepare ourselves accordingly. Bangladeshi batters batted really well and adapted  according to the situation. They were rotating the strike which was very crucial. In between we did leak a few runs but we had controlled the game very well when we were batting as I quoted earlier some bad umpiring was done we are really unhappy about some of the decisions that were given by the umpires.

Commentss: No Result - India Women Advances to Semi-Final due to Higher Ranking
TossDetails: Malaysia (Women) Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: 19Th Asian Games Women Hangzhou 2022
Comments: No Result - India Women Advances to Semi-Final due to Higher Ranking
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the quarter-final game between Women and Malaysia Women. This is the 19th edition of the Asian Games and the Women in Blue will begin their Asian campaign after getting a direct entry into the top 8 of the tournament. Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and Thailand are amongst the other teams to get a direct entry into the quarter-finals on the basis of rankings. Smriti Mandhana will be seen leading the side in the absence of Harmanpreet Kaur as India enters as a clear favorite in this Asian Games encounter.

 

Venue: ZJUT Pingfeng Cricket Field, Hangzhou

 

TOSS:-
Malaysia wins the toss and elects to  first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 62/1 (10.3 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-10 Overs) :- 

India- 49/0 (12.25 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (11-15 Overs) :- 

India- 62/1 (12.2 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

 

got off to a flying start after being asked to bat first by Malaysia. Skipper Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma came out all guns blazing smashing a little over 50 in the first five overs. Malaysia later managed to get the big wicket of Mandhana but had no answers to the Shafali Verma on-slaught which dismantled their bowling attack. Verma smashed 67 at a staggering strike rate of 171 before getting out in the 13th over. Verma and Rodrigues added 86 from just 47 balls for the 2nd wicket. Richa Ghosh coming in at number 4 displayed her power-hitting prowess scoring 21 from just 7 deliveries taking the Indian tally to a mammoth 173. Malaysian Innings had just begun when Rain played Spilsport for the second time in the game. Unfortunately, we could not get an entire game and the Match stands abandoned with India advancing to the semi-finals. The semi-final clash will be against Bangladesh on 24th September 2023!

GOLD FOR INDIA!! 

Harmanpreet Kaur was back again for India and called the toss right to bat first. Smriti (46 off 45) held one end tightly and partnered with Jemimah for 73 runs!
